name: abandon
trans:
vt.放弃，抛弃
He claimed that his parents had abandoned him他声称父母遗弃了他。

sentences.english: How could she abandon her own child?
sentences.chinese: 她怎么能抛弃自己的孩子呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 离弃， 丢弃； 遗弃； 抛弃； 放弃
detailed_translations.english: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

name: absent
trans:
a.缺席的，不在的 
He has been absent from his desk for two weeks他已经有两个星期没有坐在办公桌前了。
【派】 absence n. 缺席，不在场  【反】 present a. 出席的，在场的
【考】 be absent from 缺席

sentences.english: The dull, absent look on her face implied boredom.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上呆滞、茫然的神情说明她觉得无聊了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席的；缺少的；心不在焉的；茫然的
detailed_translations.english: not at work, school, a meeting etc, because you are sick or decide not to go
to not go to a place or take part in an event where people expect you to be

name: absolute
trans:
a.绝对的，完全的
It's not really suited to absolute beginners它并不真正适合从零开始的初学者。

sentences.english: I have absolute confidence in her.
sentences.chinese: 我对她充满信心。

sentences.english: Some of the stuff on TV is absolute rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 电视上播放的有些东西简直就是垃圾。

sentences.english: How did you do that? You’re an absolute genius.
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么做的？ 你绝对是个天才。

sentences.english: That meal last night cost an absolute fortune.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚那顿饭花了一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.english: complete or total

name: absorb
trans:
vt.吸收；吸引
Plants absorb carbon dioxide from the air and moisture from the soil植物从空气中吸收二氧化碳并从土壤中汲取水分。

sentences.english: Plants absorb nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸收养分。

sentences.english: The movement and noise of the machines absorbed him completely.
sentences.chinese: 机器的运转和声响把他完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: to take in liquid, gas, or another substance from the surface or space around something

name: abuse
trans:
n.滥用；虐待，辱骂 
I was left shouting abuse as the car sped off  汽车飞驰而去，留下我在那里大声咒骂。

sentences.english: several cases of child abuse
sentences.chinese: 数宗虐待儿童案

sentences.english: An independent committee will look into alleged human rights abuses.
sentences.chinese: 一个独立委员会将对涉嫌践踏人权的行为进行调查。

detailed_translations.english: cruel or violent treatment of someone
to deliberately use something for the wrong purpose or for your own advantage

name: academic
trans:
a.学院的，学术的
Their academic standards are high他们的教学水平很高。

sentences.english: He possessed no academic qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他没有学历。

sentences.english: a program to raise academic standards
sentences.chinese: 旨在提高学术水平的计划

detailed_translations.english: relating to education, especially at college or university level

name: accept
trans:
v.接受，认可
Eventually Sam persuaded her to accept an offer of marriage最终萨姆说服她接受了求婚。

sentences.english: Rick accepted her offer of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她请里克喝咖啡，他接受了。

sentences.english: He accepted the invitation to stay with us.
sentences.chinese: 他接受了邀请来我们家住。

sentences.english: His school reports said that he is always ready to accept a challenge (=  agree to do something difficult  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的学业报告上说他乐于接受挑战。

sentences.english: Please accept this small gift.
sentences.chinese: 请收下这份小小的礼物。

sentences.english: They offered me a job and I accepted.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我一份工作，我接受了。

sentences.english: He readily accepted her invitation (=  accepted it quickly  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他欣然接受了她的邀请。

detailed_translations.english: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do

name: accompany
trans:
v.陪伴，伴随
Ken agreed to accompany me on a trip to Africa肯答应陪我一起去非洲。

sentences.english: Children under 14 must be accompanied by an adult.
sentences.chinese: 14岁以下儿童必须有成人陪同。

sentences.english: Wherever her husband went, she would accompany him.
sentences.chinese: 不论丈夫去哪里，她都陪伴左右。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陪同， 伴随； 为…伴奏
detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere with someone

name: accomplish
trans:
v.完成 
If we'd all work together, I think we could accomplish our goal只要大家齐心协力，我想我们就能实现目标。

sentences.english: We have accomplished all we set out to do.
sentences.chinese: 所有计划要做的事情，我们都已完成。

sentences.english: Mission accomplished(=  we have done what we intended to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大功告成。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in doing something, especially after trying very hard

name: account
trans:
n.账目；解释；描述 v. 说明，解释
The flight was postponed on account of bad weather. 因为天气恶劣，飞行延期了。
【考】 on account of 因为，由于；account for 对……做出解释

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: accumulate
trans:
v.积累；堆积
Households accumulate wealth across a broad spectrum of assets家庭在以各种各样的资产形式积累财富。

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

name: accurate
trans:
a.准确的，精确的
Police have stressed that this is the most accurate description of the killer to date警方强调这是迄今对凶手最精确的描述。

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

name: accuse
trans:
vt.指控，指责，谴责；控诉
Accuse sb of doing sth charge sb with doing sth. 因为某事指控某人，指控某人做了某事。
【考】 accuse sb. of.... 指控某人……  【近】 charge

sentences.english: The professor stands accused of (=  has been accused of  ) stealing his student’s ideas and publishing them.
sentences.chinese: 那位教授被指控剽窃学生的观点拿去发表。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you believe someone is guilty of a crime or of doing something bad

name: accustomed
trans:
a.惯常的，习惯的
It will not take you very long to be accustomed to the way we do it.你不必花很长的时间就能习惯我们做事的方法。
【考】 be accustomed to + n. 习惯于

sentences.english: The pans were in their accustomed places.
sentences.chinese: 那些锅在老地方。

detailed_translations.english: usual

name: achieve
trans:
v.完成， 达到，实现，获得
There are many who will work hard to achieve these goals有志之士将会共同为实现这些目标而努力。

sentences.english: Frances achieved very good exam results.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西丝考试取得了优异成绩。

sentences.english: Wilson has achieved considerable success as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊作为一名艺术家成就斐然。

sentences.english: She eventually achieved her goal of becoming a professor.
sentences.chinese: 她终于实现目标，当上了教授。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully complete something or get a good result, especially by working hard

name: acquaintance
trans:
n.熟人，相识
The proprietor was an old acquaintance of his  业主是他的一位旧相识。

sentences.english: She was a casual acquaintance of my family in Vienna.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们家在维也纳的一个交情不深的朋友。

sentences.english: They developed an acquaintance over the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 他们在因特网上相识。

sentences.english: The practice of a lawyer requires acquaintance with court procedures.
sentences.chinese: 当律师要熟悉法庭程序。

detailed_translations.english: someone you know, but who is not a close friend

name: acquire
trans:
v.取得，学到
I've never acquired a taste for wine
我一向喝不惯葡萄酒。

sentences.english: Manning hoped to acquire valuable works of art as cheaply as possible.
sentences.chinese: 曼宁希望以尽可能低的价格买到有价值的艺术品。

sentences.english: She has acquired an email address and a site on the World Wide Web.
sentences.chinese: 她获得了一个电子邮件地址和万维网网址。

detailed_translations.chinese: 取得， 获得； 学到
detailed_translations.english: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

name: act
trans:
n.行为，动作 v. 行动；起作用；演戏
The deaths occurred when police acted to stop widespread looting and vandalism警方采取行动制止猖狂的打砸抢行为时有多人丧生。

sentences.english: The company acted correctly in sacking him.
sentences.chinese: 公司解雇他做得对。

sentences.english: The jury decided that Walker had acted in self-defence.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团裁定沃克的行为属于自卫。

sentences.english: Politicians will only act when enough people demand that they do something.
sentences.chinese: 只有足够多的民众起来要求，政客们才会采取行动。

sentences.english: The padding acts as a cushion if the player falls or is hit by the ball.
sentences.chinese: 万一球员摔倒或者被球击中，衬垫可以起到缓冲作用。

sentences.english: The new president’s first act should be to end the war.
sentences.chinese: 新总统的第一步行动应当是结束战争。

detailed_translations.english: to do something in a particular way or for a particular reason
one thing that you do

name: active
trans:
a.活跃的，积极的；在活动中的
Having an active youngster about the house can be quite wearing.
家里有个好动的小孩会是相当累人的。

sentences.english: games for active youngsters
sentences.chinese: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏

sentences.english: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
sentences.chinese: 她80多岁了，但仍旧很活跃。

sentences.english: He became politically active at college.
sentences.chinese: 他上大学时开始积极参与政治活动。

detailed_translations.english: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities

name: activity
trans:
n.活动You can take part in activities from canoeing to bird watching.
你可以参与从划独木舟到观鸟等各种活动。

sentences.english: Everyone is free to engage in peaceful political activity.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都可以自由参加和平的政治活动。

sentences.english: fund-raising activities
sentences.chinese: 筹款活动

sentences.english: Regular physical activity helps to control your weight.
sentences.chinese: 定期参加体育活动有助于控制体重。

detailed_translations.english: things that people do, especially in order to achieve a particular aim

name: actual
trans: a.实际的；现实的The segments are filmed using either local actors or the actual people involved这些片断是由当地的演员或真实的当事人参与拍摄的。

sentences.english: I’m not joking. Those were his actual words.
sentences.chinese: 我没开玩笑，那都是他的原话。

sentences.english: I know Germany won, but I can’t tell you the actual score.
sentences.chinese: 我知道德国队胜了，但我不知道确切的比分。

sentences.english: Interest is only charged on the actual amount borrowed.
sentences.chinese: 利息只按实际借款额收取。

sentences.english: In actual fact (= really  ) , there is little evidence to support the allegations.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，这些指控几乎没有证据支持。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is real or exact

name: add
trans:
v.添加；加
Sincere performances and gritty Boston settings add to the film's realism.
真诚的表演和对波士顿这一背景城市的真实刻画增添了电影的现实主义色彩。
【考】 add…to 把……加到……上；add up to 合计达，总数达

sentences.english: If the mixture seems dry, add water.
sentences.chinese: 如果混合物看上去干，加点水。

detailed_translations.english: to put something with something else or with a group of other things

name: address
trans:
n.地址，通讯处 n./v. 演讲，致词
Applications should be addressed to: The business affairs editor.
申请表应寄给；商务编辑。

detailed_translations.english: if you address a problem, you start trying to solve it

name: adequate
trans:
a.足够的，恰当的One in four people worldwide are without adequate homes
全世界有

sentences.english: Farmers have been slow to make adequate provision for their retirement.
sentences.chinese: 农民们迟迟没有为退休做好适当安排。

sentences.english: Some creams we tested failed to give adequate protection against UV light.
sentences.chinese: 我们检测的有些防晒霜不能提供足够的防紫外线保护。

sentences.english: The standard of his work is barely adequate .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作水准勉强合格。

sentences.english: The company has yet to provide an adequate explanation for its actions.
sentences.chinese: 该公司对其行动仍未作出充分解释。

detailed_translations.chinese: 足够的； 可以胜任的
detailed_translations.english: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose

name: adjust
trans:
v.调节，调整，使适应We have been preparing our fighters to adjust themselves to civil society
我们一直在培训我们的战士，以使他们适应普通的社会生活。

sentences.english: They’ll soon settle in – kids are very good at adjusting.
sentences.chinese: 他们很快就会习惯的——小孩子适应能力很强。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually become familiar with a new situation
to change or move something slightly to improve it or make it more suitable for a particular purpose

name: admire
trans:
v.羡慕，赞赏，钦佩We took time to stop and admire the view.
我们特意驻足欣赏风景。

sentences.english: I really admire the way she brings up those kids all on her own.
sentences.chinese: 我十分佩服她独力把那些孩子抚养大。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and like someone because they have done something that you think is good

name: admit
trans:
v.承认；接纳
I am willing to admit that I do make mistakes
我愿意承认我确实会犯错。

sentences.english: ‘Okay, so maybe I was a little bit scared,’ Jenny admitted.
sentences.chinese: “行了，也许我是有点害怕。”珍妮承认道。

sentences.english: I must admit , I didn’t actually do anything to help her.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，实际上我并没有帮她什么忙。

sentences.english: Admit it! I’m right, aren’t I?
sentences.chinese: 承认吧！我对了，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right
to agree unwillingly that something is true or that someone else is right

name: adopt
trans:
v.采用，采纳；收养
Parliament adopted a resolution calling for the complete withdrawal of troops
议会采纳了要求全部撤军的决议。

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

name: adult
trans:
n.成人Becoming a father signified that he was now an adult
当了父亲意味着他已是个成年人了。

sentences.english: Some children find it difficult to talk to adults.
sentences.chinese: 一些孩子觉得与大人很难谈得来。

sentences.english: an adult lion
sentences.chinese: 一头成年的狮子

detailed_translations.english: a fully-grown person, or one who is considered to be legally responsible for their actions
fully grown or developed

name: advance
trans:
n.前进，进展 v. 推进，促进；前进Everything has been fixed in advance.
一切都是事先确定好了的。
【考】 in advance 提前，预先

sentences.english: I should warn you in advance that I’m not a very good dancer.
sentences.chinese: 我要先提醒你，我跳舞不是很好。

sentences.english: Many thanks, in advance, for your help.
sentences.chinese: 对你的帮助预先表示万分感谢。

sentences.english: Could you distribute copies well in advance of the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 开会前把复印件早早分发下去，好吗？

sentences.english: A line of US tanks slowly advanced.
sentences.chinese: 一列美军坦克缓缓前进。

detailed_translations.english: before something happens or is expected to happen
to move towards someone or something, especially in a slow and determined way – used especially to talk about soldiers

name: advanced
trans: a.先进的，高级的Without more training or advanced technical skills, they'll lose their jobs.没有进一步的培训或高级技能的话，他们就会丢掉工作。

sentences.english: advanced learners of English
sentences.chinese: 高级程度的英语学习者

sentences.english: advanced physics
sentences.chinese: 高等物理（学）

detailed_translations.english: studying or dealing with a school subject at a difficult level

name: advantage
trans:
n.优点；有利条件，好处We can take advantage of new technology more quickly by farming out computer operations把计算机业务分包出去，我们就可以更快地利用新技术。
【考】 take advantage of 利用

sentences.english: Younger workers tend to be at an advantage (=  have an advantage  ) when applying for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 年轻点的工人申请工作时往往处于优势地位。

sentences.english: One of the many advantages of living in New York is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
sentences.chinese: 住在纽约的诸多好处之一是几乎任何时候都可以外出吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having this

name: adventure
trans:
n.冒险，惊险活动
I set off for a new adventure in the United States on the first day of the new year.
新年第一天，我在美国开始了一次新的冒险。

sentences.english: a great adventure
sentences.chinese: 一大奇遇

sentences.english: Ahab’s adventures at sea
sentences.chinese: 亚哈的海上历险

sentences.english: an adventure story
sentences.chinese: 一个历险故事

detailed_translations.english: an exciting experience in which dangerous or unusual things happen

name: advertise
trans: vt.为……做广告The players can advertise baked beans, but not rugby boots球员可以给烤菜豆做广告，但不能代言橄榄球靴。

sentences.english: They no longer advertise alcohol or cigarettes at sporting events.
sentences.chinese: 他们不再在体育赛事上做烟酒广告了。

sentences.english: Colleges and universities have found that it pays to advertise (=  advertising brings good results  ) .
sentences.chinese: 大专院校发现做广告效果很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…做广告， 宣传； 公告； 登广告
detailed_translations.english: to tell the public about a product or service in order to persuade them to buy it

name: advise
trans:
vt.忠告，劝告；建议
We advised that he should leave early. 我们建 议他早点出发。
【考】 advise 后接 that 从句时须用虚拟语气，即
“（should+） 动 词 原 形 ”；advise sb. to do  sth. 建议某人做某事

sentences.english: She needed someone to advise her.
sentences.chinese: 她需要有个人给她出主意。

sentences.english: ‘Make sure that you keep the documents in a safe place,’ Otley advised him.
sentences.chinese: “一定要把文件放在安全的地方。”奥特利向他建议道。

sentences.english: Keep us advised of (= continue to tell us about ) any new developments.
sentences.chinese: 请随时告诉我们任何新的进展情况。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone what you think they should do, especially when you know more than they do about something

name: affair
trans: n.事，事情，事件All their beds were distinctive; Mac's was an iron affair with brass knobs他们的床都各具特色；马克的床是张带球形黄铜柱头的铁家伙。

sentences.english: Are you interested in world affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你对世界大事感兴趣吗？

sentences.english: the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交部

sentences.english: Women had little role in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 女性过去几乎不参与公共事务。

sentences.english: the Watergate affair
sentences.chinese: 水门事件

sentences.english: He had an affair with his boss that lasted six years.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板的暧昧关系持续了六年。

detailed_translations.english: public or political events and activities

name: affect
trans:
vt.影响Nicotine adversely affects the functioning of the heart and arteries
尼古丁会对心脏及动脉功能造成损害。

sentences.english: the areas affected by the hurricane
sentences.chinese: 受飓风影响的地区

sentences.english: a disease that affects the central nervous system
sentences.chinese: 影响中枢神经系统的疾病

sentences.english: decisions which affect our lives
sentences.chinese: 影响我们生活的决定

sentences.english: Trading has been adversely affected by the downturn in consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 贸易受到消费支出回落的不利影响。

sentences.english: We were all deeply affected by her death.
sentences.chinese: 我们都为她的去世深感悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation

name: affection
trans:
n.爱，感情She thought of him with affection
她很想念他。

sentences.english: She looked back on those days with affection .
sentences.chinese: 她深情地回顾那些日子。

sentences.english: Their father never showed them much affection .
sentences.chinese: 他们的父亲对他们从来没有表现出多少慈爱。

sentences.english: Anne had two men trying to win her affections.
sentences.chinese: 安妮有两个男人追求。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of liking or loving sb/sth very much and caring about them

name: afford
trans:
vt.提供；负担得起，买得起My parents can't even afford a new refrigerator
我父母甚至买不起一台新冰箱。

sentences.english: We can’t afford to wait any longer or we’ll miss the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们再也不能等下去了，否则会赶不上飞机的。

sentences.english: The room affords a beautiful view over the city.
sentences.chinese: 这房间可以俯瞰城市美景。

sentences.english: The new law will afford protection to employees.
sentences.chinese: 新法律将为雇员提供保障。

detailed_translations.english: if you cannot afford to do something, you must not do it because it could cause serious problems for you

name: afraid
trans:
a.怕的，害怕的
She did not seem at all afraid
她毫无惧色。

sentences.english: There’s no need to be afraid.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要害怕。

sentences.english: He was afraid that the other kids would laugh at him.
sentences.chinese: 他担心其他孩子会嘲笑他。

detailed_translations.english: frightened because you think that you may get hurt or that something bad may happen

name: ago
trans:
ad.以前，……前He was killed a few days ago in a skiing accident
几天前他在一场滑雪事故中丧生。

sentences.english: They moved to a new house some time ago (=  a fairly long time ago  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们搬进新居已有些日子了。

sentences.english: We had our bicentenary celebrations not that long ago.
sentences.chinese: 不久前，我们举行了200周年庆典活动。

detailed_translations.english: used to show how far back in the past something happened

name: agree
trans:
vi.同意；赞同
【考】 agree with sb. 同意某人的意见；agree to do sth. 同意做某事
If we agreed all the time it would be a bit boring, wouldn't it?
如果我们总是意见一致，就会有点无趣，对吗？

sentences.english: Teenagers and their parents rarely agree.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子跟父母意见很少一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else

name: aggressive
trans:
a.侵略的，好斗的Some children are much more aggressive than others
一些孩子比其他孩子更好斗。

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: ahead
trans:
ad.前头，在前【考】 ahead of 在……前面，先于Thanks to your help, we accomplished the task ahead of schedule.
亏得你们帮忙，我们才提前完成了任务。

sentences.english: He kept his gaze fixed on the car ahead.
sentences.chinese: 他的目光一直盯着前面的那辆汽车。

sentences.english: We could see the lights of Las Vegas up ahead .
sentences.chinese: 我们能看到前方拉斯维加斯的灯光。

sentences.english: Henry hurried on ahead.
sentences.chinese: 亨利赶紧跑到前面。

sentences.english: The party was planned weeks ahead.
sentences.chinese: 聚会提前几个星期就已筹划好了。

detailed_translations.english: further forward in space or time; in front

name: aim
trans:
v.瞄准；致力 n. 目标，目的
He is aiming for the

sentences.english: Denver aimed his gun but did not shoot.
sentences.chinese: 丹佛举枪瞄准，但是没有射击。

sentences.english: My criticism wasn't aimed at you.
sentences.chinese: 我的批评不是针对你的。

sentences.english: They are aiming to reduce unemployment by 50%.
sentences.chinese: 他们正力求使失业人数下降50%。

detailed_translations.english: to point or direct a weapon, a shot, a kick, etc. at sb/sth

name: alarm
trans:
n.惊恐，警报（器），闹钟 v. 使惊恐；向……报警The news was greeted with alarm by MPs
得知这个消息，议员们忧心忡忡。

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

name: alcohol
trans:
n.酒精，酒Do either of you smoke cigarettes or drink alcohol?
你们俩有人吸烟或喝酒吗？

sentences.english: I don’t drink alcohol anymore.
sentences.chinese: 我不再喝酒了。

sentences.english: alcohol abuse
sentences.chinese: 酗酒

sentences.english: people with alcohol problems
sentences.chinese: 有酗酒问题的人

detailed_translations.english: drinks such as beer or wine that contain a substance which can make you drunk

name: alike
trans:
a.相同的，相像的We looked very alike.
我们长得很像。

sentences.english: My mother and I are alike in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 我和母亲在许多方面很相似。

detailed_translations.english: very similar
used to emphasize that you mean both the people, groups, or things that you have just mentioned

name: alive
trans:
a.活着的；有活力的
She does not know if he is alive or dead
她不知道他是生是死。

sentences.english: It was a bad accident – they’re lucky to be alive.
sentences.chinese: 这是一宗严重事故——他们能活着实属幸运。

sentences.english: My grandparents are still alive .
sentences.chinese: 我的祖父母和外祖父母都还健在。

sentences.english: We stayed alive by eating berries.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃浆果活命。

sentences.english: He was kept alive on a life-support machine.
sentences.chinese: 他靠生命维持装置活着。

sentences.english: Apparently he’s alive and well and living in Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 看来他还健在，住在巴西。

detailed_translations.chinese: 活着的；活泼的；有生气的
detailed_translations.english: still living and not dead

name: all
trans:
a.全部的，所有的 pron. 全部，一切 ad. 完全，都
【考】 after all 毕竟；at all 完全，根本；all over 到处，遍及；in all 总共，共计

sentences.english: There is built-in storage space in all bedrooms.
sentences.chinese: 所有卧室里都有内置储藏空间。

sentences.english: the restaurant that Hugh and all his friends go to
sentences.chinese: 休和他所有的朋友们去的那家饭馆

detailed_translations.english: the whole of an amount, thing, or type of thing
the whole of a particular group or thing or to everyone or everything of a particular kind

name: allow
trans:
vt.准许The children are not allowed to watch violent TV programmes
儿童不准收看含暴力内容的电视节目。
【考】 allow sb. to do sth. 允许某人做某事；allow doing sth. 允许做某事

sentences.english: We don’t allow diving in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 泳池内禁止跳水。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

name: alone
trans:
a.独自的，单独的 ad. 独自地，单独地
He did not have enough money to have the tire patched up, let alone buy a new one.
他的钱还不够补这个轮胎，更别提买个新的了。
【考】 let alone 不打扰；更别说

sentences.english: She lives alone.
sentences.chinese: 她一个人生活。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t leave a child alone in the house.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该把小孩独自留在家里。

sentences.english: My wife and I like to spend time alone together away from the kids.
sentences.chinese: 我和妻子喜欢没有孩子打扰，过二人世界。

sentences.english: She has lived alone in this house for almost five years now.
sentences.chinese: 她现在已经独自在这所房子里住了差不多五年了。

detailed_translations.english: if you are alone in a place, there is no one with you
without any help from other people

name: along
trans:
ad.向前 prep. 沿着
Newman walked along the street alone
纽曼独自走在街上。

sentences.english: We were driving along Follyfoot Road.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着福莱福特路行驶。

sentences.english: She glanced anxiously along the line of faces.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地扫视着这一排面孔。

sentences.english: He slid his hand along her arm.
sentences.chinese: 他的手顺着她的臂膀滑下。

sentences.english: I was driving along, thinking about Chris.
sentences.chinese: 我一边开车，一边想着克里斯。

detailed_translations.english: from one place on something such as a line, road, or edge towards the other end of it
going forward

name: although
trans:
conj.虽然，即使
Although he is known to only a few, his reputation among them is very great
虽然知道他的人不多，但他在这些人中名声却很响。

sentences.english: Although in poor health, she continued to carry out her duties.
sentences.chinese: 尽管身体不好，她仍继续执行任务。

sentences.english: We decided to take rooms in Longwood House, although we knew we could not really afford the rent.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我们知道自己其实付不起租金，但还是决定住朗伍德庄园的房间。

sentences.english: Although I can’t help admiring the man’s courage, I do not approve of his methods.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我不得不佩服那个男子的勇气，却并不赞成他的方法。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that makes your main statement seem surprising or unlikely

name: altogether
trans:
ad.完全，总之，全部
When Artie stopped calling altogether, Julie found a new man
当阿蒂彻底不再上门后，朱莉又找了个男人。

sentences.english: an old custom that has vanished altogether
sentences.chinese: 一个彻底消亡的古老习俗

sentences.english: Congress could ban the procession altogether.
sentences.chinese: 国会可以完全禁止这次游行。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something has been done completely or has finished completely
not wearing any clothes – used humorously

name: always
trans:
ad.总是，永远Whenever I get into a relationship, I always fall madly in love
我每次谈恋爱都深陷其中，无法自拔。

sentences.english: Always lock your bicycle to something secure.
sentences.chinese: 每次都要把自行车锁在牢固的物体上。

sentences.english: She’d always assumed that Gabriel was a girl’s name.
sentences.chinese: 她一直认为加布里埃尔是个女孩名字。

sentences.english: He hadn’t always been a butler.
sentences.chinese: 他并不是一直当管家。

sentences.english: I’ll always remember that day.
sentences.chinese: 我会永远记住那一天。

detailed_translations.english: all the time, at all times, or every time

name: amaze
trans:
vt.惊奇，惊叹；震惊
He amazed us by his knowledge of Welsh history
他对威尔士的历史知之甚多，让我们惊讶。

sentences.english: Dave amazed his friends by suddenly getting married.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫突然结婚，令朋友们非常吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

name: among
trans:
prep.在……之中，在……之间
They walked among the crowds in Red Square.
他们在熙熙攘攘的红场散步。

sentences.english: The girl quickly disappeared among the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 女孩转眼消失在人群中。

sentences.english: I could hear voices coming from somewhere among the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 我能听到灌木丛中某个地方传来说话的声音。

sentences.english: We walked among the chestnut woods on the mountain slopes.
sentences.chinese: 我们走在山坡上的栗树林中。

sentences.english: She began rummaging among the books on her desk.
sentences.chinese: 她开始在桌子上的一堆书中乱翻起来。

detailed_translations.english: in or through the middle of a group of people or things

name: ambition
trans:
n.雄心，野心
His ambition is to sail round the world
他的梦想是环球航行。

sentences.english: He was young and full of ambition.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，而且雄心勃勃。

detailed_translations.english: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: ambulance
trans:
n.救护车We got an ambulance and rushed her to hospital
我们叫了一辆救护车，赶紧把她送到了医院。

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 救护车服务

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我们需要叫救护车吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: [车辆][医] 救护车；战时流动医院
detailed_translations.english: a special vehicle that is used to take people who are ill or injured to hospital

name: amount
trans:
n.数量，总额 vi.（to）总计，等于【考】 a large amount of The system wastes a large amount of water.
这套系统浪费了大量的水。

sentences.english: Please pay the full amount (=  of money  ) by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 请在月底前全额付清。

detailed_translations.english: a quantity of something such as time, money, or a substance

name: amuse
trans:
v.给……以消遣，给……以娱乐
The thought seemed to amuse him
这种想法好像把他逗乐了。

sentences.english: He made funny faces to amuse the children.
sentences.chinese: 他做鬼脸逗孩子们开心。

sentences.english: The kids amused themselves playing hide-and-seek.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们玩捉迷藏玩。

sentences.english: Doing jigsaws would amuse Amy for hours on end.
sentences.chinese: 拼图能让埃米连续玩上几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone laugh or smile

name: analysis
trans:
n.[ 复数 -ses] 分析，解析
Her criteria defy analysis
她的标准让人搞不明白。

sentences.english: She’s been in analysis for three years.
sentences.chinese: 她接受精神分析治疗已经三年了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分析， 分析报告； 分解， 解析
detailed_translations.english: a process in which a doctor makes someone talk about their past experiences, relationships etc in order to help them with mental or emotional problems

name: analyze
trans:
v.分析，分解We should analyze the cause and effect of this event.
我们应该分析这场事变的因果。

sentences.english: How do you analyze this change?
sentences.chinese: 你该如何分析这种变化？

sentences.english: You have to hoover anything before you can analyze it.
sentences.chinese: 在你不具备分析能力之前，你只得胡乱吸收你所能学到的东西。

sentences.english: We should learn to discern and analyze the essentials of complicated questions.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该学会认识和分析复杂问题的本质。

name: ancient
trans:
a.古代的，古老的They believed ancient Greece and Rome were vital sources of learning.
他们认为古代希腊罗马是知识的重要发源地。

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

name: anger
trans:
n.愤怒，生气He cried with anger and frustration
他愤怒而又沮丧得哭了起来。

sentences.english: There is growing anger among the people against the government.
sentences.chinese: 民众对政府越来越不满。

sentences.english: What angered me most was his total lack of remorse.
sentences.chinese: 最让我生气的是他居然毫无悔意。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of wanting to hurt or criticize someone because they have done something bad to you or been unkind to you
to make someone angry

name: angle
trans: n.角，角度，观点The boat is now leaning at a

sentences.english: You didn’t measure the angle accurately.
sentences.chinese: 你没有量准角度。

detailed_translations.english: the space between two straight lines or surfaces that join each other, measured in degrees

name: angry
trans: a.愤怒的，生气的【考】 be angry at/with/about be angry with 后面常接的是人;be angry at后面常接的是事 Please don't be angry with me.请不要生我的气 Don't be angry at what I've done. 别因为我所做的事而生气。

sentences.english: I was angry because he hadn’t told me his plans.
sentences.chinese: 我很生气，因为他没有告诉我他的计划。

sentences.english: He was beginning to get angry .
sentences.chinese: 他开始发脾气了。

sentences.english: His comments brought an angry response from opposition politicians.
sentences.chinese: 他的话激起反对派政客愤怒的回应。

sentences.english: ‘Calm down,’ she said, looking at his angry face.
sentences.chinese: “冷静一下。”她看着他那张生气的脸说道。

sentences.english: Jesse laughed, which made me even angrier .
sentences.chinese: 杰西笑了起来，这令我更加恼火。

detailed_translations.english: feeling strong emotions which make you want to shout at someone or hurt them because they have behaved in an unfair, cruel, offensive etc way, or because you think that a situation is unfair, unacceptable etc

name: announce
trans:
vt.宣布，宣告He will announce tonight that he is resigning from office
他将于今晚宣布辞职。

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

name: annoy
trans:
v.使烦恼，使不悦，打搅Try making a note of the things which annoy you
试着把烦心事写下来。

sentences.english: He is not doing this to annoy you.
sentences.chinese: 他做这件事并非是要惹你烦恼。

sentences.english: I am convinced that some people complain just to annoy me, for something to do, or they simply enjoy complaining.
sentences.chinese: 我以为身边的人抱怨是为了令我烦恼、是为了解决某些事、又或者他们就是喜欢抱怨。

name: annual
trans:
a.每年的，每年度的
In its annual report, UNICEF says at least

sentences.english: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.chinese: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

detailed_translations.english: happening once a year

detailed_translations.chinese: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that lives for one year or season

name: anxious
trans: a.忧虑的，焦急的【考】 be anxious about/for sb./sth. be anxious about为…而担心 be anxious for急切盼望,渴望

sentences.english: She gave me an anxious look.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地看了我一眼。

sentences.english: He seemed most anxious to speak to me alone.
sentences.chinese: 他似乎迫切地想同我单独谈谈。

detailed_translations.english: causing anxiety; showing anxiety

name: anyhow
trans:
ad.无论如何，不管怎样
I wasn't qualified to apply for the job really but I got it anyhow.
实际上我并不具备申请这份工作的资格，但不管怎样，我还是被录用了。

sentences.english: "Anyhow," she added briskly, "it's none of my business."
sentences.chinese: “不管怎样”，她轻松地补充说，“这不关我的事。”

detailed_translations.english: anyway

name: apart
trans:
ad.分离，隔开；相距，相隔【考】 apart from 除了……以外
Apart from Bobby, all the children like music. （除了鲍比，所有的孩子都喜欢音乐。）

sentences.english: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
sentences.chinese: 他们的办事处远至印度、秘鲁等国。

sentences.english: The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
sentences.chinese: 警方在所有的比赛中都设法将双方的支持者分开。

sentences.english: A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart .
sentences.chinese: 几名男子打起架来，我们不得不将他们拉开。

sentences.english: Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
sentences.chinese: 乔尔皱着眉头，独自站在一边。

sentences.english: Their concept of a performance and our concept were miles apart.
sentences.chinese: 他们对一场表演的概念和我们的概念相去甚远。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成距离，相间隔；分开，除去
detailed_translations.english: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other
If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it

name: apparent
trans:
a.明显的， 表面上的I was a bit depressed by our apparent lack of progress
我对我们看似缓慢的进展感到有些沮丧。

sentences.english: The difference in quality was immediately apparent .
sentences.chinese: 质量的差异显而易见。

sentences.english: He left suddenly, for no apparent reason .
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，他突然离开了。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice

name: appear
trans:
n.出现，出场，问世 v. 好像是，仿佛There appears to be increasing support for the leadership to take a more aggressive stance
好像有越来越多的人支持领导层采取更为强势的立场

sentences.english: Police have found what appear to be human remains.
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了疑似人体遗骸的东西。

sentences.english: He tried to make it appear that she had committed suicide.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制造她自杀的假象。

sentences.english: It may be less useful than it appears at first.
sentences.chinese: 这可能没有一开始显得那么有用。

sentences.english: Two faces appeared at our window.
sentences.chinese: 两张面孔出现在我们的窗口。

sentences.english: The car seemed to appear from nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车好像是突然间从哪里冒出来的。

detailed_translations.english: used to say how something seems, especially from what you know about it or from what you can see

name: appearance
trans:
n.出现；外表，外观
It was the president's second public appearance to date
这是总统到那时为止的第二次公开露面。

sentences.english: He was always criticising his wife’s appearance.
sentences.chinese: 他老是批评妻子的外表。

sentences.english: We are often attracted to somebody first by their physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 我们经常先被一个人的外貌吸引。

sentences.english: Women, in general, tend to be more concerned than men about their personal appearance .
sentences.chinese: 总的来说，女性比男性更注重自己的仪容。

sentences.english: She had an outward appearance of calm, but deep down she was really worried.
sentences.chinese: 她表面上很镇静，内心却十分担忧。

sentences.english: The metal posts spoiled the appearance of the garden.
sentences.chinese: 金属柱子破坏了花园的外观。

sentences.english: A garnish helps to enhance the appearance of any dish.
sentences.chinese: 装饰菜能为任何菜肴增色。

sentences.english: She’s the kind of woman who takes pride in her appearance .
sentences.chinese: 她是那种对自己的外貌感到自豪的女人。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t judge by appearances .
sentences.chinese: 你不该以貌取人。

sentences.english: They work hard at school without giving the appearance of being particularly hard-working.
sentences.chinese: 他们在学校里学习很用功，只是表面上并不显得特别如此。

sentences.english: The case had all the appearances of a straightforward murder.
sentences.chinese: 从所有迹象来看，这个案件都像一宗简单的谋杀。

sentences.english: The pupils looked angelic – but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 这些学生看上去如天使一般，但外表可能是会骗人的。

sentences.english: He was, to all appearances , a respectable, successful businessman.
sentences.chinese: 从各方面看，他都是个体面而成功的商人。

sentences.english: The industry has changed greatly with the appearance of new technologies.
sentences.chinese: 新技术问世后，这一行业出现了天翻地覆的变化。

detailed_translations.english: the way someone or something looks to other people

name: appetite
trans:
n.食欲，胃口
He has a healthy appetite
他胃口很好。

sentences.english: Her husband always had a huge appetite.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫向来胃口极大。

sentences.english: Symptoms include tiredness and loss of appetite.
sentences.chinese: 症状包括疲倦和食欲不振。

detailed_translations.english: a desire for food

name: apply
trans: vt.应用；申请【考】 apply for 申请，请求；apply to 致力于，适用于

sentences.english: We need to apply for planning permission to build a garage.
sentences.chinese: 我们建车库需要申请规划许可。

detailed_translations.chinese: 应用，实施，使用；适用；申请，请求
detailed_translations.english: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something
to put or spread something such as paint, liquid, or medicine onto a surface

name: appoint
trans:
v.任命，委托；约定，指定
It made sense to appoint a banker to this job
指派一位银行家做这份工作是明智之举。

sentences.english: officials appointed by the government
sentences.chinese: 政府任命的官员

sentences.english: The committee appointed a day in June for celebrations.
sentences.chinese: 委员会把庆典定在6月的一天举行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 任命，委派；约定，确定，指定
detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for a position or a job

name: appreciate
trans:
v.欣赏；感激【考】 appreciate doing 
I appreciate you doing this.
我很感谢你做的这些事情

sentences.english: Thanks ever so much for your help, I really appreciate it.
sentences.chinese: 多谢你的帮助，我真的很感激。

sentences.english: I appreciate your concern , but honestly, I’m fine.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢你关心，不过说真的，我很好。

sentences.english: I’d appreciate it if you let me get on with my job.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能让我继续工作，我会非常感激。

sentences.english: Her abilities are not fully appreciated by her employer.
sentences.chinese: 她的才干没有得到雇主的充分赏识。

sentences.english: I’m not an expert, but I appreciate fine works of art.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：我不是专家，但我欣赏优秀的艺术作品。

detailed_translations.english: used to thank someone in a polite way or to say that you are grateful for something they have done

name: approach
trans:
n.（to） 接 近； 途 径， 方 法vt. 靠近，接近He didn't approach the front door at once
他没有马上走向前门。

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

name: appropriate
trans:
a.适合的，恰当的
It is appropriate that Irish names dominate the list
名单上大部分是爱尔兰名字，这没什么不合适的

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: approve
trans:
vt.批准 vi. 赞成【考】 approve of 赞成……Not everyone approves of the festival
不是所有人都赞成庆祝该节日。

sentences.english: You've never approved of Henry, have you?
sentences.chinese: 你从未赞赏过亨利，是吧？

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable

name: approximately
trans: ad.近似地，大约In the course of the

sentences.english: The journey took approximately seven hours.
sentences.chinese: 旅程大约花了七个小时。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that sth is almost, but not completely, accurate or correct

name: area
trans: n.面积；地区；领域

sentences.english: Only cheeses made in this area may be labelled ‘Roquefort.’
sentences.chinese: 只有这个地区出产的干酪才能被称作“罗克福尔干酪”。

sentences.english: Crime rates are much higher in urban areas.
sentences.chinese: 城镇地区的犯罪率要高很多。

sentences.english: an area of 2,000 square miles
sentences.chinese: 2,000平方英里的面积

sentences.english: The course covers three main subject areas.
sentences.chinese: 这门课程涵盖三大学科领域。

detailed_translations.english: a particular part of a country, town etc

name: argue
trans: vi.争辩，争论【考】 argue with sb. over/about sth. 就某事同某人争论He is arguing with his mum.他正在和他的妈妈争论。They argued about this issue yesterday.他们昨天就这个问题发生争论。

sentences.english: We could hear the neighbours arguing.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到邻居在争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with someone in words, often in an angry way
to persuade someone to do or not do something

name: arise
trans:
vi.出现，形成【考】 arise from 由……引起
Noisome vapours arise from the mud left in the docks
难闻的蒸汽由船坞中余留的泥浆散发出来。

sentences.english: A crisis has arisen in the Foreign Office.
sentences.chinese: 外交部出现了危机。

sentences.english: More problems like those at the nuclear power plant are certain to arise.
sentences.chinese: 核电厂肯定还会出现那样的问题。

detailed_translations.english: if a problem or difficult situation arises, it begins to happen

name: arouse
trans:
vt.引起，激起，唤起；唤醒
We left in the daytime so as not to arouse suspicion.
我们在白天离开以避免引起怀疑。

sentences.english: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.english: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

detailed_translations.english: to make you become interested, expect something etc; to wake someone

name: arrange
trans:
vt.安排，布置
I've arranged to see him on Friday morning
我已安排好星期五上午见他。

sentences.english: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请联络当地分部安排预约。

sentences.english: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
sentences.chinese: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

sentences.english: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
sentences.chinese: 马修两点钟依约而至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 准备； 整理
detailed_translations.english: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

name: arrive
trans: v.到来，到达；达成，得出【考】 arrive at+ 小地点； arrive in+ 大地方arrive in Beijing     arrive at school      arrive at the park

sentences.english: Give me a call to let me know you’ve arrived safely.
sentences.chinese: 打个电话给我，告诉我你已平安到达。

sentences.english: By the time the police arrived on the scene, the burglars had fled.
sentences.chinese: 警方赶到现场时，窃贼已经逃跑了。

sentences.english: When her wedding day arrived, she was really nervous.
sentences.chinese: 到了婚礼那天，她十分紧张。

detailed_translations.english: to get to the place you are going to

name: artificial
trans:
a.人工的，人造的；不自然的The city is dotted with small lakes, natural and artificial
这个城市小型湖泊星罗棋布，有天然的也有人工的。

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

sentences.english: artificial light
sentences.chinese: 人造光

sentences.english: artificial fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥

detailed_translations.english: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

name: ashamed
trans:
a.惭愧的；羞愧的【考】 be ashamed of/to do/that 对……感到羞愧I felt incredibly ashamed of myself for getting so angry
我对自己发那么大的火而深感惭愧。

sentences.english: Everyone cries sometimes – it’s nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会有哭的时候——没什么好难为情的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

name: aspect
trans:
n.（问题、事物等的）方面
Climate and weather affect every aspect of our lives
气候和天气影响着我们生活的方方面面。

sentences.english: a south-facing aspect
sentences.chinese: 朝南方向

detailed_translations.english: one part of a situation, idea, plan etc that has many parts

name: assemble
trans:
v.集合，集会；装配，组装There wasn't even a convenient place for students to assemble between classes
在课间，学生们连一个方便凑在一起的地方都没有。

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: assembly
trans:
n.集会，会议；装配
He waited until complete quiet settled on the assembly.
他一直等到集会的人群完全安静下来。

sentences.english: Police have imposed conditions on public assemblies.
sentences.chinese: 警方给公共集会设置了条件。

sentences.english: Restrictions on freedom of assembly have gradually been relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 对集会自由的限制渐渐放宽了。

sentences.english: an assembly point
sentences.chinese: 集合地点

sentences.english: instructions for assembly
sentences.chinese: 装配说明（书）

detailed_translations.english: the meeting together of a group of people for a particular purpose

name: assign
trans:
v.分配，分派；选派When I taught, I would assign a topic to children which they would write about
我教课时会给孩子们布置一个题目，让他们就这个题目写点东西。

sentences.english: How much time have you assigned for the meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你给这个会议定了多长时间？

detailed_translations.chinese: 指派， 分配； 布置； 指定
detailed_translations.english: to give someone a particular job or make them responsible for a particular person or thing

name: assist
trans:
v.援助，帮助
Julia was assisting him to prepare his speech
朱莉娅正在帮他准备讲演稿。

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

detailed_translations.english: to help someone to do something
If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them

name: assume
trans:
v.认为；假定；承担
It is a misconception to assume that the two continents are similar
关于这两块大陆相似的假设是一种误解

sentences.english: I think we can safely assume (=  it is almost certain  ) that interest rates will go up again soon.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们几乎可以肯定，利率很快会再次上调。

sentences.english: When it got to midnight and Paul was still not back, I began to assume the worst (=  think that the worst possible thing had happened  ) .
sentences.chinese: 到午夜时保罗还没回来，我就开始往最坏的地方想了。

sentences.english: Whoever they appoint will assume responsibility for all financial matters.
sentences.chinese: 不管他们任命的是谁，他都要负责财务方面的所有事务。

sentences.english: These relationships assume great importance in times of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在危急时刻，这些关系显得尤为重要。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is true, although you do not have definite proof

name: assure
trans: v.保证，使确信【考】assure sb. of sth. I will ensure that the car arrives by six o'clock.我保证汽车六点钟以前到。

sentences.english: The document is genuine, I can assure you .
sentences.chinese: 我能向你保证，这文件是真的。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something will definitely happen or is definitely true so that they are less worried

name: astonish
trans:
vt.使惊讶【考】be astonished at sth. 对某事感到惊讶My news will astonish you
我的消息会让你感到十分惊讶的。

sentences.english: Her reply astonished me.
sentences.chinese: 她的回答让我大吃一惊。

sentences.english: It astonished him that she had changed so little.
sentences.chinese: 他很惊讶，她几乎没怎么变。

sentences.english: What astonishes me most is his complete lack of fear.
sentences.chinese: 最令我吃惊的是，他什么都不怕。

detailed_translations.english: to surprise someone very much

name: atmosphere
trans:
n.大气；大气层；气氛he Partial Test-Ban Treaty bans nuclear testing in the atmosphere.
《部分禁止核试验条约》禁止在大气层中进行核试验。

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: attach
trans:
vt.系；贴；附加
We attach labels to things before we file them away
存档前，我们先贴上标签。

sentences.english: When approving a merger, the commission can attach conditions.
sentences.chinese: 委员会在批准公司合并时可能附加条件。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缚， 系， 贴， 附加； 使依恋， 使喜爱； 使附属； 认为有
detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, but only if someone agrees to do a particular thing or accept a particular idea

name: attack
trans:
n.攻击，抨击 v. 攻击，袭击【考】make an attack on/upon 向…进攻，攻击；The commander disposed his forces so as to make an attack on the enemy.
司令官对他的部队做了部署以便进攻敌军。

sentences.english: a bomb attack
sentences.chinese: 炸弹袭击

sentences.english: a knife attack
sentences.chinese: 持刀攻击

sentences.english: an arson attack
sentences.chinese: 纵火袭击

sentences.english: victims of racial attacks
sentences.chinese: 种族袭击的受害者

detailed_translations.chinese: 攻击， 进攻； 突然发作
detailed_translations.english: an act of violence that is intended to hurt a person or damage a place

name: attain
trans:
v.达到；完成；获得
Jim is halfway to attaining his pilot's licence.
吉姆就快要拿到飞行员执照了。

sentences.english: More women are attaining positions of power.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女性获得要职。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time
to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

name: attempt
trans:
n.努力，尝试 vt. 尝试，试图The only time that we attempted to do something like that was in the city of Philadelphia
只有在费城那次我们曾试着做那样的事
【考】an attempt to 力图，试图；make an attempt at/on 打算，试

sentences.english: Weather conditions prevented them from attempting the jump.
sentences.chinese: 天气状况使他们无法尝试跳伞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尝试， 试图， 努力
detailed_translations.english: to try to do something, especially something difficult

name: attend
trans:
vt.出席Thousands of people attended the funeral
数千人参加了葬礼。

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

name: attention
trans:
n.注意，关心【考】 pay attention to 注意You have my undivided attention
我专心听你所讲。

sentences.english: My attention wasn’t really on the game.
sentences.chinese: 我的注意力其实不在比赛上。

sentences.english: She tried to pay attention to what he was saying.
sentences.chinese: 她尽量注意听他说话。

sentences.english: If you paid more attention in class, you might actually learn something!
sentences.chinese: 要是你上课更认真些，也许能实实在在地学到些东西！

sentences.english: Scott sat down at his desk and turned his attention to the file he had in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特在自己的办公桌前坐下，将注意力转向面前的文件。

sentences.english: As a society we need to give more attention to the needs of older people.
sentences.chinese: 生活在同一社会里，我们得更加关注长者的需求。

sentences.english: Now he’s gone, I can give you my undivided attention .
sentences.chinese: 现在他已经走了，我可以把全部注意力都放在你身上。

sentences.english: This game is fun and is sure to keep the attention of any young student.
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏很有趣，一定能使年幼学生保持注意力。

sentences.english: They listened to the speech with close attention .
sentences.chinese: 他们很认真地听演讲。

sentences.english: Attention to detail is essential in this job.
sentences.chinese: 关注细节是这份工作所必需的。

sentences.english: During the lecture Sarah’s attention began to wander .
sentences.chinese: 上课时，萨拉开始走神了。

detailed_translations.english: when you carefully listen to, look at, or think about someone or something

name: attitude
trans:
n.态度，看法Being unemployed produces negative attitudes to work
失业会产生对工作的消极态度。

sentences.english: As soon as they found out I was a doctor, their whole attitude changed.
sentences.chinese: 他们一听说我是医生，态度就完全改变了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 态度， 看法； 姿势
detailed_translations.english: the opinions and feelings that you usually have about something, especially when this is shown in your behaviour

name: attract
trans:
vt.吸引，引起The Cardiff Bay project is attracting many visitors
加的夫海湾项目吸引了众多游客。

sentences.english: I’m not usually attracted to blondes.
sentences.chinese: 我一般不喜欢金发女子。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone interested in something, or make them want to take part in something

name: audience
trans:
n.听众，观众
The entire audience broke into loud applause
全场观众爆发出热烈的掌声。

sentences.english: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.english: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

detailed_translations.english: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work

name: author
trans:
n.作者；作家Haruki Murakami is Japan's best-selling author.
村上春树是日本当红的畅销书作家。

sentences.english: Nothomb is a Belgian author.
sentences.chinese: 诺东是位比利时作家。

sentences.english: It’s clear that the author is a woman.
sentences.chinese: 显然，这位作者是女性。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has written a book

name: automobile
trans:
n.汽车The parts of an automobile are standardized.
汽车零件是标准化了的。

sentences.english: the automobile industry
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业

detailed_translations.english: a car

name: available
trans:
a.可利用的，可得到的
Since

sentences.english: Tickets are available from the box office.
sentences.chinese: 售票处有票出售。

sentences.english: Meetings were held to update employees as soon as new information became available .
sentences.chinese: 一有新的信息就开会告诉员工。

sentences.english: Further building can continue when money is made available .
sentences.chinese: 有了资金就可以继续进一步的施工。

sentences.english: Every available space on the wall was covered in pictures.
sentences.chinese: 墙上每一个可用的地方都挂上了画。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可利用的，现有的；可获得的
detailed_translations.english: something that is available is able to be used or can easily be bought or found

name: average
trans:
a.平均的；普通的 n. 平均数【考】 on the/an average 平均The fish were counted and an average weight recorded.
数了数鱼的数量，并把平均重量记录了下来。

sentences.english: The average American has not even thought about next year’s election.
sentences.chinese: 普通的美国人甚至还没有想过明年的选举。

sentences.english: In an average week I drive about 250 miles.
sentences.chinese: 平常我每周开车约250英里。

detailed_translations.english: having qualities that are typical of most people or things

name: avoid
trans: v.避免，避开【考】 avoid doing sth. 避免做某事I must avoid doing such a thing. 我必须避免做这样的事

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: awake
trans:
a.醒着的【反】 asleep 
I don't stay awake at night worrying about that
我并没有因为那件事而担心得彻夜不眠。

sentences.english: I hope he’s awake now.
sentences.chinese: 我希望他现在醒着。

sentences.english: She was still only half awake when I brought her a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我给她端去咖啡的时候，她还是半睡半醒的样子。

sentences.english: How do you stay awake during boring lectures?
sentences.chinese: 听无聊的课你是怎样不让自己睡着的？

sentences.english: Emma lay awake half the night, worrying.
sentences.chinese: 埃玛忧心忡忡，半宿都没睡着。

sentences.english: The noise brought him wide awake (=  completely awake  ) .
sentences.chinese: 那声音使他睡意全无。

sentences.english: It was midday when she awoke.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时已是中午。

detailed_translations.english: not sleeping
to wake up, or to make someone wake up

name: award
trans:
n.奖品 vt. 授予，奖给【考】 award sb. sth. 奖给某人某物She presented a bravery award to schoolgirl Caroline Tucker.
她向女学生卡罗琳·塔克颁发了英勇奖状。

sentences.english: Moodie has been awarded a golf scholarship at the University of Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 穆迪获授夏威夷大学高尔夫奖学金。

sentences.english: The movie has won a number of awards.
sentences.chinese: 该片获得了多个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to officially give someone something such as a prize or money to reward them for something they have done
something such as a prize or money given to someone to reward them for something they have done

name: aware
trans:
a.意识到的，知道的【考】 be aware of 知道，意识到
Smokers are well aware of the dangers to their own health
吸烟的人都知道吸烟对自身健康的危害。

sentences.english: I don't think people are really aware of just how much it costs.
sentences.chinese: 我认为人们并不真正明白这要花多少钱。

sentences.english: Were you aware that something was wrong?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有意识到已经出了问题？

detailed_translations.english: knowing or realizing sth

name: awful
trans:
a.使人畏惧的，可怕的We met and I thought he was awful
我们见了面，我觉得他很讨人厌。

sentences.english: The weather was awful.
sentences.chinese: 天气很糟糕。

detailed_translations.english: very bad or unpleasant

name: awkward
trans:
a.笨拙的；尴尬的
I was the first to ask him awkward questions but there'll be harder ones to come
我是第一个向他提出尴尬问题的人，不过还会有人问更难回答的问题。


【B】

sentences.english: I hoped he would stop asking awkward questions .
sentences.chinese: 我希望他不要再问令人难堪的问题。

sentences.english: There was an awkward moment when she didn’t know whether to shake his hand or kiss his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她不知道是该跟他握手还是亲他的脸颊，一时很尴尬。

sentences.english: an awkward silence
sentences.chinese: 令人尴尬的沉默

sentences.english: A laugh can help people over an awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 笑可以助人化解尴尬。

sentences.english: Philip’s remarks put her in an awkward position (=  made it difficult for her to know what to do  ) .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普的话使她很窘迫。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

name: background
trans:
n.背景，经历Moulded by his background, he could not escape the traditional role of strict father
受成长环境的影响，他摆脱不了严父的传统角色

sentences.english: Students with a background in chemistry will probably find the course easier.
sentences.chinese: 学过化学的学生可能会觉得这门课程容易些。

sentences.english: It’s important to understand other people, people from different backgrounds .
sentences.chinese: 要理解别人，理解那些来自不同背景的人，这是很重要的。

sentences.english: Do you know anything about his background?
sentences.chinese: 关于他的背景，你知道什么吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 出身背景， 经历； 背景资料； 背景， 底子
detailed_translations.english: someone’s family, education, previous work etc

name: balance
trans:
n.平衡 v. 使平衡，保持平衡
【考】 keep/lose one’s balance 保持 / 失去平衡

sentences.english: She balanced the cup on her knee.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子在膝盖上放稳。

detailed_translations.english: to put your body or sth else into a position where it is steady and does not fall
an instrument for weighing things, with two dishes that hang from a bar

name: bargain
trans:
n.特价商品，便宜货 v. 讨价还价【考】 bargain with sb. 与某人讨价还价At this price the wine is a bargain
这种葡萄酒卖这个价真是很便宜。

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

detailed_translations.english: an agreement, made between two people or groups to do something in return for something else
to discuss the conditions of a sale, agreement etc, for example to try and get a lower price

name: barrier
trans:
n.栅栏；障碍（物）Duties and taxes are the most obvious barrier to free trade.
关税和税收是自由贸易的最大壁垒。

sentences.english: He advocated the removal of trade barriers.
sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: base
trans:
v.把……建在，以……为基础 n. 基地，基础There was a cycle path running along this side of the wall, right at its base
在墙的这边，沿着墙根有一条自行车道。
【考】 be based on 以……为基础；on the bases of基于【派】 basic a. 基本的，基础的

sentences.english: India has a good scientific research base.
sentences.chinese: 印度有良好的科研基础。

detailed_translations.english: the most important part of something, from which new ideas develop
not having good moral principles
to have your main place of work, business etc in a particular place

name: battle
trans:
v.与……作战 n. 战斗，战役
He was appalled to discover members of the board fighting damaging personal battles.
他惊恐地发现董事会成员正在进行你死我活的私人争斗。

sentences.english: the Battle of Trafalgar
sentences.chinese: 特拉法尔加战役

sentences.english: a pitched battle (=  a long and serious battle  ) between police and drug gangs
sentences.chinese: 警方和贩毒团伙之间的一场激战

detailed_translations.english: a fight between opposing armies, groups of ships, groups of people etc, especially one that is part of a larger war

name: beauty
trans:
n.美，美丽；美人
Everyone admired her elegance and her beauty.
人人都羡慕她的优雅和美丽。

sentences.english: her beauty and grace
sentences.chinese: 她的美貌和优雅风姿

sentences.english: an area of outstanding natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 一个自然风景极美的地区

sentences.english: Millions of dollars are spent each year on beauty products.
sentences.chinese: 每年都有上千万的钱花在美容产品上。

sentences.english: She was considered a great beauty in her youth.
sentences.chinese: 她年轻时被视为大美人。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that people, places, or things have that makes them very attractive to look at

name: because
trans:
conj.因为【考】 because of 由于，因为It is mainly because of my fault.
这主要是由于我的过错。

sentences.english: We didn’t enjoy the day because the weather was so awful.
sentences.chinese: 那天我们很不尽兴，因为天气实在太糟。

sentences.english: ‘Why can’t I go?’ ‘Because you’re not old enough.’
sentences.chinese: “我为什么不能去？”“因为你年纪太小。”

sentences.english: Hubert never experienced any fear, and this was partly because he was not particularly intelligent.
sentences.chinese: 休伯特从来都没有害怕的感觉，部分原因是他这人不大聪明。

sentences.english: Many exam candidates lose marks simply because they do not read the questions properly.
sentences.chinese: 许多应试者失分只是因为没有好好地读题。

sentences.english: I decided to go with them, mainly because I had nothing better to do.
sentences.chinese: 我决定和他们一起去，主要是因为我没有更好的事情可做。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are giving the reason for something

name: behalf
trans:
n.利益；代表【考】 on behalf of/ on one’s behalf 代表某人
She made an emotional public appeal on her son's behalf
她代表儿子动情地发出了公开呼吁。

sentences.english: She asked the doctor to speak to her parents on her behalf.
sentences.chinese: 她请医生代她同她父母谈谈。

sentences.english: On behalf of everyone here, may I wish you a very happy retirement.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我代表在座的各位祝你退休后生活愉快。

detailed_translations.english: instead of someone, or as their representative

name: belong
trans:
vi.属于【考】 belong to 属于
The house had belonged to her family for three or four generations.
这套房子归她们家有三四代人了。

sentences.english: The house had belonged to her family for three or four generations.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子属于她家已有三四代了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 属于，应归入；居住；适宜；应被放置
detailed_translations.english: If something belongs to you, you own it

name: bend
trans:
v.（使）弯曲
I bent over and kissed her cheek
我俯身亲吻了她的脸颊。

sentences.english: Lee bent and kissed her.
sentences.chinese: 李俯下身来亲她。

sentences.english: She bent her head.
sentences.chinese: 她低下头。

sentences.english: Bend your knees, but keep your back straight.
sentences.chinese: 膝盖弯曲，背部保持挺直。

detailed_translations.english: to move part of your body so that it is not straight or so that you are not upright
to become curved and no longer flat or straight
a curved part of something, especially a road or river

name: benefit
trans:
v.有益于；得益于n. 利益，好处
【考】表示“得益于”时常与 from/by 连用【派】 beneficial a. 有益的
All the cells and tissues in the body benefit from the increased intake of oxygen.
体内所有的细胞与组织都从增加的氧气吸入量中受益。

sentences.english: They are working together to benefit the whole community.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为整个社区的利益共同努力。

detailed_translations.english: if you benefit from something, or it benefits you, it gives you an advantage, improves your life, or helps you in some way

detailed_translations.chinese: 利益，恩惠；救济金，保险金，津贴
detailed_translations.english: money provided by the government to people who are sick, unemployed, or have little money

name: bind
trans:
vt.捆绑，捆扎
It is the memory and threat of persecution that binds them together.
遭受迫害的记忆和威胁把他们紧紧联系在一起。

sentences.english: The monks are bound by vows of silence.
sentences.chinese: 僧侣们必须遵守保持缄默的誓言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合；装订；有约束力；过紧
detailed_translations.english: if you are bound by an agreement, promise etc, you must do what you have agreed to do or promised to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 捆绑；困境；讨厌的事情；植物的藤蔓
detailed_translations.english: an annoying or difficult situation

name: blame
trans:
vt.指责；把……归咎于
She seemed to be placing most of the blame on her mother
她好像把大部分责任都推到了母亲身上。

The policy is partly to blame for causing the worst unemployment in Europe.
欧洲出现了最严重的失业情况，这应当部分归咎于这项政策。
【考】 blame ... on 把……归咎于；blame ... for 为……责备某人

sentences.english: Don’t blame me – it’s not my fault.
sentences.chinese: 别来怪我——又不是我的错。

sentences.english: I blame his mother. She does everything for him.
sentences.chinese: 怪他母亲不好，她什么事都要为他做。

detailed_translations.english: to say or think that someone or something is responsible for something bad

name: blow
trans:
v.吹；吹气；（使）爆炸 n. 打击
A chill wind blew at the top of the hill
山顶寒风呼啸。

sentences.english: A cold breeze was blowing hard.
sentences.chinese: 寒风劲吹。

sentences.english: It was blowing from an easterly direction.
sentences.chinese: 这是从东面吹过来的。

sentences.english: Outside, the weather was blowing a gale.
sentences.chinese: 外面狂风大作。

sentences.english: Her hair was blowing in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发在微风中飘扬。

sentences.english: The whistle blew for half time.
sentences.chinese: 哨声响起，上半场结束。

detailed_translations.english: if the wind or a current of air blows, it moves

name: boast
trans:
v.（of/about）夸口，夸耀
Witnesses said Furci boasted that he took part in killing them
几位证人声称富尔奇曾吹嘘自己参与了对他们的屠杀。

sentences.english: The city boasts two excellent museums.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市以拥有两个优秀的博物馆而自豪。

sentences.english: The Society boasts 3,000 members worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这个协会以拥有3,000名来自世界各地的会员而自豪。

sentences.english: It is the charity's proud boast that it has never yet turned anyone away.
sentences.chinese: 该慈善机构自吹自擂，声称从来没有拒绝过任何人。

detailed_translations.english: if a place, object, or organization boasts something, it has something that is very good

detailed_translations.chinese: 自夸，吹嘘；以拥有…而自豪
detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about your abilities, achievements, or possessions

detailed_translations.chinese: 自吹自擂， 自夸的话
detailed_translations.english: Boast is also a noun

name: boil
trans:
v.沸腾，煮沸
I stood in the kitchen, waiting for the water to boil
我站在厨房，等着水烧开。

sentences.english: Put the spaghetti into plenty of boiling salted water.
sentences.chinese: 把意大利面放入大量煮沸的盐水中。

sentences.english: We were advised to boil the water before drinking it.
sentences.chinese: 有人建议我们把这水烧开后再喝。

detailed_translations.english: when a liquid boils, or when you boil it, it becomes hot enough to turn into gas
the act or state of boiling

name: boring
trans:
a.令人生厌的
Not only are mothers not paid but also most of their boring or difficult work is unnoticed.
母亲们不但得不到报酬，而且她们做的那些乏味艰苦的工作常常都不为人所注意。
【考】 v. -ed 形容词有被动或已完成的意思；v.-ing 形 容 词 有 主 动 或 进 行 的 含 义：
bored—boring；surprised—surprising；interested—interesting； amazed—amazing。

sentences.english: Her husband is about the most boring person I’ve ever met.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫可以说是我见过的最无聊的人。

sentences.english: The job was dull and boring.
sentences.chinese: 这份工作枯燥乏味。

detailed_translations.chinese: 令人厌烦的， 乏味的， 无聊的
detailed_translations.english: not interesting in any way

name: bother
trans: v.打扰，麻烦【近】 trouble

sentences.english: Danny, don’t bother Ellen while she’s reading.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼，埃伦看书的时候不要去打扰她 。

sentences.english: You seem to have got yourself into a spot of bother.
sentences.chinese: 你似乎让自己遇上了点麻烦。

detailed_translations.english: to annoy, worry or upset sb
trouble or difficulty

name: bottom
trans:
n.底，底部
He sat at the bottom of the stairs
他坐在最下面的一级楼梯上。

sentences.english: Can you hold the bottom of the ladder for me?
sentences.chinese: 你帮我扶住梯子底部好吗？

detailed_translations.english: the lowest part of something

name: brain
trans:
n.大脑；头脑，智能
Her father died of a brain tumour.
她父亲死于脑瘤。

sentences.english: Messages from the brain are carried by the central nervous system.
sentences.chinese: 大脑发出的信息是通过中枢神经系统传递的。

sentences.english: the chemistry of the brain
sentences.chinese: 大脑的化学性质

sentences.english: the human brain
sentences.chinese: 人脑

sentences.english: She died of a brain tumour.
sentences.chinese: 她死于脑瘤。

sentences.english: The job requires brains.
sentences.chinese: 做这工作需要头脑。

detailed_translations.english: the organ inside your head that controls how you think, feel, and move

name: branch
trans:
n.树枝；分支
The local branch of Bank of America is handling the accounts
美国银行在当地的分行正在处理这些账目。

sentences.english: After the storm, the ground was littered with twigs and branches.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，满地都是大大小小的树枝。

sentences.english: The topmost branches were full of birds.
sentences.chinese: 树梢上停满了鸟儿。

sentences.english: She now works in our Denver branch.
sentences.chinese: 现在她在我们的丹佛分部工作。

sentences.english: a branch of mathematics/physics/biology etc
sentences.chinese: 数学/物理/生物学等的分支

detailed_translations.english: a part of a tree that grows out from the trunk and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it

name: brave
trans:
a.勇敢的He was not brave enough to report the loss of the documents.
他没有勇气报告丢失了文件。

sentences.english: brave soldiers
sentences.chinese: 勇敢的士兵

sentences.english: her brave fight against cancer
sentences.chinese: 她与癌症的勇敢搏斗

detailed_translations.english: dealing with danger, pain, or difficult situations with courage and confidence
to deal with a difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant situation
a young fighting man from a Native American tribe

name: breath
trans:
n.呼吸，气息【考】 out of breath 上气不接下气
By the time I got to the top of the hill, I was quite out of breath.
等我爬到山顶的时候，已经是上气不接下气了。

sentences.english: Slow down, I need to catch my breath.
sentences.chinese: 慢一点，我要喘口气。

detailed_translations.english: the air that you take into your lungs and send out again

name: breathe
trans:
v.呼吸，呼气
He stood there breathing deeply and evenly
他站在那儿均匀地深呼吸。

sentences.english: The room filled with smoke, and it was becoming difficult to breathe.
sentences.chinese: 房间里全是烟，呼吸越来越困难。

sentences.english: People are concerned about the quality of the air they breathe.
sentences.chinese: 人们关心他们所呼吸的空气的质量。

sentences.english: Relax and breathe deeply (=  take in a lot of air  ) .
sentences.chinese: 放松，深呼吸。

detailed_translations.english: to take air into your lungs and send it out again
to take air into your lungs and send it out again

name: brief
trans:
a.简短的，短暂的【考】 in brief 简要地说She once made a brief appearance on television
她曾经在电视上短暂露面。

sentences.english: We stopped by Alice’s house for a brief visit.
sentences.chinese: 我们顺路在艾丽斯家小坐片刻。

sentences.english: Let’s keep this conversation brief; I have a plane to catch.
sentences.chinese: 我们长话短说吧，我还要赶飞机。

sentences.english: A Defense Department spokesman briefed reporters.
sentences.chinese: 一位国防部发言人向记者们介绍了情况。

detailed_translations.english: continuing for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 向…介绍基本情况，做…的提要
detailed_translations.english: If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it
a short spoken or written statement giving facts about a law case

name: bright
trans:
a.明亮的；聪明的
She leaned forward, her eyes bright with excitement.
她身体前倾，眼里闪动着兴奋的光芒。

sentences.english: Her eyes were hurting from the bright lights.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的光线刺痛了她的眼睛。

sentences.english: bright sunshine
sentences.chinese: 灿烂的阳光

sentences.english: a large bright room
sentences.chinese: 明亮的大房间

sentences.english: He was an exceptionally bright child.
sentences.chinese: 他是个特别聪明的孩子。

detailed_translations.english: shining strongly, or with plenty of light

name: brilliant
trans:
a.卓越的，杰出的；极聪明的She had a brilliant mind
她头脑聪明。

sentences.english: She closed her eyes against the brilliant light.
sentences.chinese: 强烈的光线下，她闭起了眼睛。

sentences.english: We sat outside in the brilliant sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在外面，沐浴在灿烂的阳光下。

sentences.english: She was dressed in brilliant white.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一身耀眼的白色。

sentences.english: The film was absolutely brilliant.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影极为出色。

detailed_translations.english: brilliant light or colour is very bright and strong

name: bubble
trans:
n.泡，水泡，气泡
Ink particles attach themselves to air bubbles and rise to the surface.
墨汁颗粒附着在气泡上，浮到表面上。

sentences.english: When water boils, bubbles rise to the surface.
sentences.chinese: 水烧开时，水面会冒泡泡。

sentences.english: soap bubbles
sentences.chinese: 肥皂泡

sentences.english: She was blowing bubbles in her milk with a straw.
sentences.chinese: 她用吸管在牛奶里吹泡泡。

sentences.english: Heat the cheese until it bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 把奶酪加热到冒泡。

detailed_translations.english: a ball of air or gas in liquid
to produce bubbles

name: build
trans:
vt.建筑，建立
I am determined to build on this solid foundation.我决定在这个坚实的基础之上继续努力。
The regime built up the largest army in Africa该政权逐渐建立起一支非洲规模最大的军队。
【考】build on/upon 建立在…基础上；build up增强

sentences.english: The purpose is to build new houses for local people.
sentences.chinese: 目的是要为当地居民建造新的住宅。

sentences.english: The road took many years to build.
sentences.chinese: 这条路修了好几年。

sentences.english: They needed $3 million to build the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 他们需要300万美元来修建这座桥。

sentences.english: It is the female birds that build the nests.
sentences.chinese: 筑巢的是雌鸟。

sentences.english: She had built a reputation as a criminal lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 她已经树立起了刑事诉讼律师的声望。

sentences.english: She’s been busy building her career.
sentences.chinese: 她忙于创建自己的事业。

detailed_translations.english: to make something, especially a building or something large

name: bunch
trans:
n.束，捆，串My neighbours are a bunch of busybodies
我的邻居们是一群爱管闲事的人。

sentences.english: She bunched the cloth up and threw it away.
sentences.chinese: 她把布揉成一团扔了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 集中， 挤在一起； 形成一束
detailed_translations.english: to pull material together tightly in folds
a group of things that are fastened, held, or growing together
to hold or tie things together in a bunch

name: bundle
trans: n.捆，包，束  a bundle of clothes 一包衣物

sentences.english: a small bundle containing mostly clothing
sentences.chinese: 一个小包袱，里面主要是衣服

sentences.english: He was bundled into a car and driven 50 miles to a police station.
sentences.chinese: 他被塞进一辆小汽车，被带到50英里外的警察局。

detailed_translations.english: a group of things such as papers, clothes, or sticks that are fastened or tied together

detailed_translations.chinese: 收集， 归拢； 把…塞入
detailed_translations.english: If someone is bundled somewhere, someone pushes them there in a rough and hurried way

name: burden
trans:
n.担子，负担
The developing countries bear the burden of an enormous external debt
发展中国家背负着巨额外债。

sentences.english: His family responsibilities had started to become a burden.
sentences.chinese: 家庭责任已开始成为他的负担。

detailed_translations.english: something difficult or worrying that you are responsible for

name: bury
trans:
v.埋葬；埋藏
They make the charcoal by burying wood in the ground and then slowly burning it.
他们通过把木材埋到地下缓慢燃烧来获取木炭。

sentences.english: Electric cables are buried beneath the streets.
sentences.chinese: 电缆埋在街道的下面。

detailed_translations.english: to put someone who has died in a  grave

detailed_translations.chinese: (Bury)人名；(法)比里；(英、西)伯里；(德、意、罗、波、捷、匈)布里；(俄)布雷

name: busy
trans:
a.忙的，忙碌的
What is it? I'm busy什么事？我忙着呢。
be busy doing sth侧重于动作sth是名词哦·do是动词的形式be busy with sth侧重于状态意思都一样,可以互换.He is busy doing home work.=He is busy with homework.
【考】 be busy at/with sth. 忙于某事；be busy doing sth. 忙于做某事


【C】

sentences.english: She’s busy now – can you phone later?
sentences.chinese: 她现在正忙，你稍后打来好吗？

sentences.english: a busy mother of four
sentences.chinese: 一个忙忙碌碌、育有四个孩子的妈妈

sentences.english: There were lots of activities to keep the kids busy .
sentences.chinese: 有很多活动可以让孩子们不闲着。

sentences.english: December is the busiest time of year for shops.
sentences.chinese: 十二月份是一年中商店最繁忙的时期。
