sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

name: mutual
trans: a.相互的，共同的

sentences.english: I didn’t like Dev, and the feeling seemed to be mutual.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢德夫，他好像也不喜欢我。

sentences.english: The two men were a mutual admiration society , gushing about how much they were learning from each other.
sentences.chinese: 两个男人互相吹捧，盛赞对方让自己受益匪浅。

detailed_translations.english: mutual feelings such as respect, trust, or hatred are feelings that two or more people have for each other

name: mystery
trans:
n.神秘，神秘的事物


【N】

sentences.english: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery .
sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.english: The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
sentences.chinese: 她脑子里在想些什么对他来说始终是个谜。

sentences.english: ‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery .’
sentences.chinese: “他为什么这么做？” “我不知道，这完全是个谜。”

sentences.english: The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

sentences.english: But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened .
sentences.chinese: 但为什么会有人想杀死杰克呢？疑团越来越深了。

sentences.english: What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery .
sentences.chinese: 后来那些画的命运如何是个不解之谜。

sentences.english: I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他是怎么得到那份工作的——那永远是个小小的谜。

sentences.english: How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
sentences.chinese: 地球生命的起源是一大科学谜团。

detailed_translations.english: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it

name: name
trans: a.名字；名声 v. 命名，取名【考】 name after 以……名字命名

sentences.english: Her name is Mandy Wilson.
sentences.chinese: 她的名字是曼迪•威尔逊。

sentences.english: What’s your name?
sentences.chinese: 你叫什么名字？

sentences.english: He didn’t want to do anything to damage the good name of the company.
sentences.chinese: 他不想做任何有损公司良好声誉的事。

sentences.english: They’re a lot better than some airlines I could name.
sentences.chinese: 他们比我叫得上名字的一些航空公司要好得多。

detailed_translations.english: what someone is called
to say what the name of someone or something is, especially officially

name: native
trans: n.土著，当地人 a. 本国的，土生的

sentences.english: Singapore has many native species of palm.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡有很多土生的棕榈树种。

sentences.english: You can always tell the difference between the tourists and the natives.
sentences.chinese: 游客与当地人之间的区别一望即知。

detailed_translations.english: growing, living, produced etc in one particular place
someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time

name: nature
trans: n.大自然；天性

sentences.english: We grew up in the countryside, surrounded by the beauties of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们在乡村长大，周围是美丽的大自然。

sentences.english: nature conservation
sentences.chinese: 自然保护

sentences.english: Disease is nature’s way of keeping the population down.
sentences.chinese: 疾病是大自然控制人口的方法。

sentences.english: I tried appealing to his better nature (= his feelings of kindness ) but he wouldn’t agree to help us.
sentences.chinese: 我想唤起他的善良本性，但他就是不同意帮助我们。

sentences.english: Capitalist society is by its very nature unstable.
sentences.chinese: 从本质而言，资本主义社会是不稳定的。

detailed_translations.english: everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather

name: necessary
trans: a.必须的，必要的，必然的

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

name: negative
trans: a.消极的；否定的

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: nerve
trans: n.神经，胆量

sentences.english: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
sentences.chinese: 影响背部神经的疾病

sentences.english: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
sentences.chinese: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。

detailed_translations.english: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body

name: nervous
trans: a.神经的，紧张不安的

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

name: normal
trans: a.正常的

sentences.english: A normal working week is 40 hours.
sentences.chinese: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

sentences.english: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
sentences.chinese: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。

sentences.english: All I want is to lead a normal life.
sentences.chinese: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

detailed_translations.english: usual, typical, or expected

name: notice
trans:
v.注意，通知，留心 n. 注意，布告，通知
【考】 take no notice of sb./sth. 不理会……


【O】

sentences.english: He noticed a woman in a black dress sitting across from him.
sentences.chinese: 他看到有位黑衣女子坐在他的对面。

sentences.english: I didn’t notice any smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我没注意到有烟。

sentences.english: Have you noticed any change in him?
sentences.chinese: 你注意到他有什么变化了吗？

sentences.english: I waved but they took no notice.
sentences.chinese: 我挥了挥手，可是他们没有注意到。

sentences.english: Firefighters were prepared to rush out at a moment’s notice.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员准备着随时出动。

detailed_translations.english: if you notice something or someone, you realize that they exist, especially because you can see, hear, or feel them
when you notice or pay attention to someone or something

name: obey
trans: v.服从，听由【反】 disobey

sentences.english: The little boy made no effort to obey.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩不肯服从。

sentences.english: ‘Sit!’ he said, and the dog obeyed him instantly.
sentences.chinese: “坐下！”他说道，那只狗马上就服从了。

detailed_translations.english: to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do
to do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a law or rule says you must do

name: object
trans:
n.物，物体；宾语
【例】 A “black hole” is an object made by pure energy. 黑 洞 是一种由纯能量组成的物质。

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: objective
trans: n.目标 a. 客观的

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: observe
trans: v.观察，观测；发现；遵守；庆祝【近】 notice

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: obstacle
trans: n.障碍，干扰【考】 an obstacle to… 对……的障碍

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: obtain
trans: vt.获得，得到【考】 obtain sth. from sb./sth. 从……获得……

sentences.english: These conditions no longer obtain.
sentences.chinese: 这些状况已不复存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通用， 流行； 存在
detailed_translations.english: if a situation, system, or rule obtains, it continues to exist
to get something that you want, especially through your own effort, skill, or work

name: obvious
trans: a.明显的，显而易见的

sentences.english: The obvious way of reducing pollution is to use cars less.
sentences.chinese: 减少污染显而易见的办法就是少用汽车。

detailed_translations.english: easy to notice or understand

name: occasion
trans: n.场合，时节，时刻

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

name: occupy
trans: v.占用，占；占领；占据（时间）

sentences.english: Football occupies most of my leisure time.
sentences.chinese: 足球占去了我大部分的闲暇时间。

detailed_translations.english: if something occupies you or your time, you are busy doing it

name: occur
trans:
vi.发生，出现，存在
【考】 occur to sb. 某人想起……；It occurs to sb.that ... 念头浮现于某人的脑海

sentences.english: A third of accidental deaths occur in the home.
sentences.chinese: 有三分之一的意外死亡发生在家里。

sentences.english: The explosion occurred at 5.30 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸发生在清晨5点30分。

detailed_translations.english: to happen

name: offend
trans: v.冒犯，使不快

sentences.english: His remarks deeply offended many Scottish people.
sentences.chinese: 他的话严重冒犯了许多苏格兰人。

sentences.english: The careful language is designed not to offend.
sentences.chinese: 使用谨慎的语言是为了不得罪人。

sentences.english: In Western countries girls are far less likely to offend than boys.
sentences.chinese: 在西方国家，女孩们远不像男孩们那样容易犯罪。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry or upset by doing or saying something that they think is rude, unkind etc
to commit a crime or crimes

name: offer
trans: v.提供，提议

sentences.english: Can I offer you something to drink?
sentences.chinese: 我给你拿点喝的好吗？

sentences.english: I can’t turn down the offer of a free trip to Milan!
sentences.chinese: 我怎能拒绝免费去米兰旅行的机会！

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone if they would like to have something, or to hold something out to them so that they can take it
a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

name: omit
trans: v.省略，忽略

sentences.english: Please don’t omit any details, no matter how trivial they may seem.
sentences.chinese: 请不要忽略任何细节，不管它多细小。

detailed_translations.english: to not include someone or something, either deliberately or because you forget to do it

name: operate
trans: vt.操作 vi. 运转；动手术；起作用

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works
to use and control a machine or equipment

name: opinion
trans: n.看法，见解【考】 in one’s opinion 在某人看来

sentences.english: What’s your opinion of Cathy?
sentences.chinese: 你对凯茜的看法如何？

detailed_translations.english: your ideas or beliefs about a particular subject

name: opportunity
trans: n.机会【近】 chance

sentences.english: There are fewer opportunities for new graduates this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年新毕业的大学生就业机会较少。

detailed_translations.english: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

name: oppose
trans: v.反对

sentences.english: Congress is continuing to oppose the President’s health care budget.
sentences.chinese: 国会继续反对总统的医疗保健预算。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something such as a plan or idea and try to prevent it from happening or succeeding

name: opposite
trans: a.对面的；相反的 n. 相反，对立，对立面

sentences.english: I thought the medicine would make him sleep, but it had the opposite effect.
sentences.chinese: 我以为这药会让他睡觉，但是它却起了反作用。

sentences.english: At the opposite extreme, Ashworth’s style is very simple and modern.
sentences.chinese: 截然相反的是，阿什沃思的风格非常简单和现代。

sentences.english: Bob was quicker than Ed? It’s usually the opposite way round.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃比埃德快？通常是反过来的。

detailed_translations.english: as different as possible from something else
a person or thing that is as different as possible from someone or something else

name: optional
trans: a.可以任选的

sentences.english: three optional courses
sentences.chinese: 三门选修课

sentences.english: The other excursions are optional.
sentences.chinese: 其他的短途旅行是自选项目。

detailed_translations.english: if something is optional, you do not have to do it or use it, but you can choose to if you want to

name: order
trans:
n.顺序；秩序 v. 命令；定购；点菜
【考】 in order to do sth. 目的在于做某事；out of order 无次序的；有毛病的，出故障的；
in order 按顺序

sentences.english: There seemed to be no logical order to the sections.
sentences.chinese: 这几部分似乎没有逻辑顺序。

sentences.english: Let’s have some order in here.
sentences.chinese: 我们把这里整理一下吧。

sentences.english: The court ordered his release from prison.
sentences.chinese: 法院下令放他出狱。

detailed_translations.english: the way that things or events are arranged in relation to each other, so that one thing is first, another thing is second etc
to tell someone that they must do something, especially using your official power or authority

name: ordinary
trans: a.平常的，普通的

sentences.english: It’s just an ordinary camera.
sentences.chinese: 这只是普通的相机。

sentences.english: The book is about ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 这本书描写的是普通人。

sentences.english: Art should be part of ordinary life.
sentences.chinese: 艺术应该是日常生活的一部分。

sentences.english: It is good because it is written in friendly, ordinary language.
sentences.chinese: 它很不错，因为它是用平易近人的日常语言写的。

detailed_translations.english: average, common, or usual, not different or special

name: organize
trans: vt.组织，安排

sentences.english: The course was organized by a training company.
sentences.chinese: 这一课程是由一家培训公司组织的。

sentences.english: Students need to learn how to organize their work.
sentences.chinese: 学生要学会如何安排好自己的学习。

sentences.english: We are learning about how genes are organized.
sentences.chinese: 我们在了解基因是如何排列的。

detailed_translations.english: to make the necessary arrangements so that an activity can happen effectively

name: origin
trans: n.起源，来源，由来

sentences.english: The tradition has its origins in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 这一传统源于中世纪。

sentences.english: old folk tales of unknown origin
sentences.chinese: 起源不明的古老民间传说

detailed_translations.chinese: 起源， 起因； 出身， 血统
detailed_translations.english: the place or situation in which something begins to exist

name: output
trans: n.产出；产量

sentences.english: Output is up 30% on last year.
sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

name: outstanding
trans: a.杰出的，优秀的

sentences.english: an outstanding example of a 13th-century castle
sentences.chinese: 13世纪城堡的杰出典范

sentences.english: an outstanding success
sentences.chinese: 了不起的成功

sentences.english: His performance was outstanding.
sentences.chinese: 他的表演相当出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杰出的；显著的；未解决的；未偿付的
detailed_translations.english: extremely good

name: overcome
trans: v.战胜；压倒；克服

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

name: overlook
trans: v.俯瞰，忽略，宽容

sentences.english: Our room overlooks the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房间可以俯视大海。

sentences.english: It is easy to overlook a small detail like that.
sentences.chinese: 那样的小细节很容易被忽略。

sentences.english: She found him entertaining enough to overlook his faults.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得他很有趣，足以让她包容他的缺点。

detailed_translations.english: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

name: overnight
trans: ad.一夜间；突然

sentences.english: He became a millionaire overnight.
sentences.chinese: 他一夜之间就成了百万富翁。

detailed_translations.english: suddenly or surprisingly quickly
happening during the night or for the night

name: owe
trans: v.欠，应向……支付，得到感激

sentences.english: How much do I owe you (= often used to show that you want to pay for something )?
sentences.chinese: 我该付你多少钱？

sentences.english: He owes his success to hard work.
sentences.chinese: 他的成功是靠勤奋工作。

detailed_translations.english: to need to pay someone for something that they have done for you or sold to you, or to need to give someone back money that they have lent you

name: own
trans: v.拥有 a. 自己的

sentences.english: Bring your own equipment.
sentences.chinese: 带上你自己的装备。

sentences.english: Every dance has its own rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 每一种舞蹈都有自己的节奏。

sentences.english: The yacht was intended for the King’s own personal use.
sentences.chinese: 这艘游艇是专供国王私用的。

sentences.english: His face was only a few inches from her own.
sentences.chinese: 他的脸离她自己的脸非常近。

sentences.english: The building is owned by the local council.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼归地方议会所有。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something belongs to or is connected with a particular person or thing and not any other
to have something which belongs to you, especially because you have bought it, been given it etc and it is legally yours

name: owner
trans:
n.物主，所有人


【P】

sentences.english: He was now the proud owner of a bright red sports car.
sentences.chinese: 他现在拥有了一辆亮红色跑车，很是自豪。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns something

name: pace
trans: n.步子，步速

sentences.english: He quickened his pace , longing to be home.
sentences.chinese: 他加快步伐，盼望着早点回到家中。

sentences.english: Traffic slowed to a walking pace.
sentences.chinese: 车流速度减缓，犹如步行。

sentences.english: I found Mark at the hospital, pacing restlessly up and down.
sentences.chinese: 我看见马克在医院里焦躁不安地踱来踱去。

detailed_translations.english: the speed at which someone walks, runs, or moves
to walk first in one direction and then in another many times, especially because you are nervous

name: pack
trans: v.包装，挤满 n. （一）包，（一）群

sentences.english: I forgot to pack my razor.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记把剃须刀放入行李包了。

sentences.english: Hundreds of people packed into the mosque.
sentences.chinese: 成百上千的人挤进了清真寺。

sentences.english: Send away for your free information pack today.
sentences.chinese: 今天就来函索取免费资料包吧。

detailed_translations.english: to put things into cases, bags etc ready for a trip somewhere
something wrapped in paper or packed in a box and then sent by post or taken somewhere

name: passive
trans: a.被动的，消极的

sentences.english: Kathy seems to take a very passive role in the relationship.
sentences.chinese: 凯茜在这一关系中似乎扮演着十分被动的角色。

sentences.english: their passive acceptance of their fate
sentences.chinese: 他们对命运的消极接受

detailed_translations.english: someone who is passive tends to accept things that happen to them or things that people say to them, without taking any action

name: patient
trans: n.病人，患者 a. 有耐心的

sentences.english: You’ll just have to be patient and wait till I’m off the phone.
sentences.chinese: 你只能耐心点，等我打完电话。

sentences.english: She was tough but wonderful with her patients.
sentences.chinese: 她很严厉，但对病人很好。

detailed_translations.english: able to wait calmly for a long time or to accept difficulties, people’s annoying behaviour etc without becoming angry
someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital

name: pattern
trans: n.模式，式样；图案，花样

sentences.english: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

sentences.english: A general pattern began to emerge .
sentences.chinese: 一个总体模式开始显现。

sentences.english: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (= always develop in the same way ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。

sentences.english: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

sentences.english: a dress pattern
sentences.chinese: 连衣裙的纸样

detailed_translations.english: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

name: perfect
trans: a.完美的，极好的

sentences.english: His English was perfect.
sentences.chinese: 他的英语很地道。

sentences.english: The car was in perfect condition.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车的车况极佳。

sentences.english: You’re very lucky to have perfect teeth.
sentences.chinese: 你能拥有一口完美的牙齿太幸运了。

sentences.english: a perfect performance
sentences.chinese: 完美的演出

sentences.english: In a perfect world, we wouldn’t need an army.
sentences.chinese: 在理想世界中，我们不需要军队。

detailed_translations.english: not having any mistakes, faults, or damage

name: perform
trans: v.表演；做，完成；行动

sentences.english: Chenier and the band are performing at the Silver Palace tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 车尼尔和乐队明天将在银宫演出。

sentences.english: The children perform two plays each school year.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们一学年表演两部话剧。

sentences.english: She was fired for not performing the duties outlined in her contract.
sentences.chinese: 由于没有履行合同中规定的职责，她被解雇了。

detailed_translations.english: to do something to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music

name: period
trans: n.时期，时代，一段时间

sentences.english: Tomorrow’s weather will be dry with sunny periods.
sentences.chinese: 明天天气干燥，间或晴朗。

sentences.english: a double period of Science
sentences.chinese: 一连两节的自然科学课

sentences.english: Pay attention to punctuation, especially to the correct use of commas and periods.
sentences.chinese: 注意标点，特别是逗号和句号的正确使用方法。

detailed_translations.english: a particular length of time with a beginning and an end

name: permanent
trans: a.永久的，持久的

sentences.english: He gave up a permanent job in order to freelance.
sentences.chinese: 他放弃了固定工作，为的是当一名自由职业者。

sentences.english: a permanent change in your eating habits
sentences.chinese: 饮食习惯的永久改变

sentences.english: The blindness that the disease causes will be permanent.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病引起的失明是永久性的。

sentences.english: Miller soon became a permanent fixture (= someone or something that is always there ) on the team.
sentences.chinese: 米勒很快就成为球队的固定队员。

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist for a long time or for all the time in the future

name: permit
trans:
v.允许，许可        【考】 permit sb. sth. 允许；
permit doing sth. 允许做某事；permit sb. to do sth. 允许某人做某事

sentences.english: Smoking is only permitted in the public lounge.
sentences.chinese: 只允许在公共休息室里抽烟。

sentences.english: He had more than the permitted level of alcohol in his blood.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量超出了允许的水平。

detailed_translations.english: to allow something to happen, especially by an official decision, rule, or law
an official written statement giving you the right to do something

name: personal
trans: a.个人的，私人的；本人的，亲身的

sentences.english: My personal view is that we shouldn’t offer him the job.
sentences.chinese: 我个人认为我们不该给他这份工作。

sentences.english: Style and colour are a matter of personal taste .
sentences.chinese: 款式和颜色是个人爱好问题。

sentences.english: She took full personal responsibility for all the arrangements.
sentences.chinese: 她个人对所有的安排承担全部责任。

sentences.english: When I went to her room all her personal belongings had gone.
sentences.chinese: 我到她房间时，她所有的私人物品都已不在了。

sentences.english: After Alan’s death, his mother received his personal effects .
sentences.chinese: 艾伦死后，他母亲接收了他的私人物品。

sentences.english: I know from personal experience that you can’t trust Ralph.
sentences.chinese: 根据我的亲身经验，我认为你不能相信拉尔夫。

sentences.english: the personal qualities needed to be successful in business
sentences.chinese: 生意成功所需要的个人素质

sentences.english: The car is for personal use only.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车仅供私人使用。

sentences.english: On a personal level he felt sympathy for them, but he had a job to do.
sentences.chinese: 从个人角度他很同情他们，但是他有任务在身。

sentences.english: celebrities with their own personal trainer
sentences.chinese: 拥有私人健身教练的名流

detailed_translations.english: belonging or relating to one particular person, rather than to other people or to people in general

name: persuade
trans:
v.说服，劝说
【考】 persuade sb. to do sth.=persuade sb. into doing sth. 说服某人做某事

sentences.english: He was fairly easily persuaded .
sentences.chinese: 他很轻易就被说服了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 说服，劝说；使某人相信；劝某人做（不做）某事
detailed_translations.english: to make someone decide to do something, especially by giving them reasons why they should do it, or asking them many times to do it

name: philosopher
trans: n.哲人【派】 philosophy n. 哲学

sentences.english: Plato, Aristotle, and other Greek philosophers
sentences.chinese: 柏拉图、亚里士多德和其他希腊哲学家

detailed_translations.english: someone who studies and develops ideas about the nature and meaning of existence, truth, good and evil etc

name: physical
trans: a.身体的；物理的【派】 physicist n. 物理学家

sentences.english: She was in constant physical pain.
sentences.chinese: 她一直感到身上疼痛。

sentences.english: the physical and emotional needs of young adults
sentences.chinese: 青年人的身心需求

sentences.english: people with severe physical disabilities
sentences.chinese: 身体重度残疾的人

sentences.english: Don’t be put off by his physical appearance .
sentences.chinese: 别因为他的外貌讨厌他。

sentences.english: He was obsessed with physical fitness .
sentences.chinese: 他对健身着了迷。

detailed_translations.english: related to someone’s body rather than their mind or emotions

name: pick
trans:
vt.挑选，选择；拾起；学会（语言）
【考】 pick up 捡起；乘载；学会；pick out 挑出，选出；辨别出

sentences.english: The Roman Swiss Army knife has a knife, spoon, fork, spike, spatula, and small pick.
sentences.chinese: 这种古罗马瑞士军刀包含了刀，勺，叉，长钉，抹刀和小鹤嘴锄。

detailed_translations.english: a  pickaxe

name: pioneer
trans: n.先驱者，开拓者

sentences.english: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
sentences.chinese: 达科他地区的早期拓荒者

detailed_translations.english: someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people
to be the first person to do, invent or use something

name: place
trans:
vt.放置，安置，安排 n. 地方，处境，职务
【考】 take place 发生，出现；take the place of 代替， 取 代；
in place of 代 替；out of place不得其所的，不适当的

sentences.english: Make sure you keep the key in a safe place.
sentences.chinese: 一定要把钥匙放在安全的地方。

sentences.english: I’ve spent the day dashing about from place to place.
sentences.chinese: 我这一天尽是在东奔西跑。

sentences.english: The place was full of screaming children.
sentences.chinese: 那地方全是大叫大嚷的孩子们。

sentences.english: He was threatening to burn the place down.
sentences.chinese: 他扬言要把那地方烧毁。

sentences.english: She had never been back to the place where the accident happened.
sentences.chinese: 她再也没回过事故发生的地点。

sentences.english: The theatre bar was our usual meeting place.
sentences.chinese: 这个剧院酒吧是我们见面的老地方。

sentences.english: We were living then in a place called Alberiga.
sentences.chinese: 那时候我们住在一个叫阿尔伯里格的地方。

sentences.english: The wall was quite damp in places (= in some places ) .
sentences.chinese: 墙上有几处很潮湿。

sentences.english: Did the accident happen at your place of work (= the place where you work ) ?
sentences.chinese: 事故是在你的工作地点发生的吗？

sentences.english: It took us ages to find a place to live.
sentences.chinese: 我们花了好长时间才找到一个住处。

detailed_translations.english: a space or area, for example a particular point on a surface or in a room, building, town, city etc

name: point
trans:
v.指 n. 尖端；点；观点；意义
【考】 point at 指向；point out 指出，指明；come to the point 说到要点，扼要地说

sentences.english: The party's share of the vote fell by ten percentage points.
sentences.chinese: 该党的得票率下跌了十个百分点。

sentences.english: Here are the main points of the news.
sentences.chinese: 以下是新闻摘要。

sentences.english: There are three important points we must bear in mind.
sentences.chinese: 有三个要点我们必须记住。

sentences.english: He is three points behind the leader.
sentences.chinese: 他落后领先者三分。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or unit on a scale of measurement

name: poison
trans: n.毒物，毒药 v. 放毒，毒害

sentences.english: Belladonna and red arsenic are deadly poisons .
sentences.chinese: 颠茄和雄黄都是致命的毒物。

sentences.english: a box of rat poison
sentences.chinese: 一盒鼠药

sentences.english: He killed several people by poisoning their tea.
sentences.chinese: 他在茶里下毒杀死了几个人。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that can cause death or serious illness if you eat it, drink it etc
to give someone poison, especially by adding it to their food or drink, in order to harm or kill them

name: polite
trans: a.有礼貌的，客气的

sentences.english: She’s always very polite.
sentences.chinese: 她总是很有礼貌。

sentences.english: polite, well-behaved children
sentences.chinese: 懂礼貌、守规矩的孩子

sentences.english: a clear but polite request
sentences.chinese: 明确但客气的请求

sentences.english: It’s not polite to talk with your mouth full.
sentences.chinese: 满嘴食物时讲话是不礼貌的。

detailed_translations.english: behaving or speaking in a way that is correct for the social situation you are in, and showing that you are careful to consider other people’s needs and feelings

name: politics
trans: n.政治；政治学

sentences.english: I assume her politics must be fairly conservative.
sentences.chinese: 我猜她的政治观点一定相当保守。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s political beliefs and opinions

name: pollute
trans: v.污染

sentences.english: beaches polluted by raw sewage
sentences.chinese: 受未经处理的污水污染的海滩

sentences.english: The factory pollutes the air and water.
sentences.chinese: 那家工厂污染了空气和水。

detailed_translations.english: to make air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use

name: population
trans: n.人口

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

name: possess
trans:
vt.持有，拥有
【考】 in possession of 拥 有；in the possession of（某物）为（某人）所有

sentences.english: Different workers possess different skills.
sentences.chinese: 不同的工人拥有不同技能。

sentences.english: He no longer possessed the power to frighten her.
sentences.chinese: 他再也吓不倒她了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular quality or ability

name: postpone
trans: vt.推迟，延期【近】 delay v. 延缓；使延期

sentences.english: The match had to be postponed until next week.
sentences.chinese: 比赛不得不推迟到下周举行。

sentences.english: His trial has been postponed indefinitely (= no one knows when it will happen ) .
sentences.chinese: 对他的审判被无限期推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: to change the date or time of a planned event or action to a later one

name: potential
trans: a.潜在的；可能的 n. 潜力

sentences.english: The company has identified 60 potential customers.
sentences.chinese: 该公司已确定了60位潜在的客户。

detailed_translations.english: likely to develop into a particular type of person or thing in the future
the possibility that something will develop in a particular way, or have a particular effect

name: poverty
trans: n.贫困，贫穷

sentences.english: Millions of elderly people live in poverty .
sentences.chinese: 数百万老年人生活在贫困之中。

sentences.english: We need an effective strategy to fight poverty .
sentences.chinese: 我们需要制定一个有效的对策来与贫困作斗争。

sentences.english: continued efforts to alleviate poverty and raise living standards
sentences.chinese: 缓解贫困和提高生活水平的不懈努力

sentences.english: scenes of abject poverty
sentences.chinese: 极度贫困的情景

sentences.english: the causes of urban poverty
sentences.chinese: 造成城市贫困的原因

detailed_translations.english: the situation or experience of being poor

name: powerful
trans: a.强有力的

sentences.english: He was one of the most powerful men in Bohemia.
sentences.chinese: 他是波希米亚最有权势的人物之一。

sentences.english: a very influential and powerful family
sentences.chinese: 很有权势的家庭

sentences.english: a powerful speech
sentences.chinese: 有感染力的演讲

detailed_translations.english: a powerful person, organization, group etc is able to control and influence events and other people’s actions

name: practical
trans: a.实际的，实用的

sentences.english: Candidates should have training and practical experience in basic electronics.
sentences.chinese: 应征者应该具备基础电子学方面的培训和实践经验。

sentences.english: the practical problems of old age
sentences.chinese: 老年的实际问题

sentences.english: They provide financial and practical help for disabled students.
sentences.chinese: 他们为残障学生提供经济上的援助以及实际的帮助。

sentences.english: a combination of theoretical and practical training
sentences.chinese: 理论培训和实践培训的结合

sentences.english: They haven’t thought about the practical consequences of the new regulations.
sentences.chinese: 他们没有考虑过新法规会产生什么实际后果。

sentences.english: In practical terms, this means spending more time with each student.
sentences.chinese: 具体地说，这意味着花更多的时间和每个学生在一起。

detailed_translations.english: relating to real situations and events rather than ideas, emotions etc

name: practice
trans:
n.习惯，常规，惯例
【考】 in practice 在 实 践 中， 实 际 上；out of practice 久不练习，荒疏

sentences.english: religious beliefs and practices
sentences.chinese: 宗教信仰和习俗

sentences.english: dangerous working practices
sentences.chinese: 危险的工作方法

detailed_translations.english: something that people do often, especially a particular way of doing something or a social or religious custom

name: pray
trans: v.祈祷，祈求

sentences.english: They went to the mosque to pray.
sentences.chinese: 他们去清真寺祷告。

detailed_translations.english: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks

name: predict
trans: vt.预言，预测

sentences.english: Sales were five percent lower than predicted.
sentences.chinese: 销售额比预期低5%。

sentences.english: As Liz had predicted , the rumours were soon forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 正如利兹所预料的，流言很快就被淡忘了。

detailed_translations.english: to say that something will happen, before it happens

name: prefer
trans:
v.更喜欢，宁可，宁愿
【考】 （

sentences.english: She prefers her coffee black.
sentences.chinese: 她更喜欢喝黑咖啡。

detailed_translations.english: to like someone or something more than someone or something else, so that you would choose it if you could

name: preserve
trans: vt.保护，维护；保存

sentences.english: We must encourage the planting of new trees and preserve our existing woodlands.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须鼓励栽种新树木，同时也要保护现有的林地。

detailed_translations.english: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

name: deserve
trans: vt.应受，该得

sentences.english: What have I done to deserve this?
sentences.chinese: 我做了什么事，要得到这样的报应？

sentences.english: I’m sorry for the kids. They deserve better (= deserve to be treated in a better way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我为这些孩子感到难过，他们应该过得更好。

sentences.english: Ledley deserves a place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 莱德利应该在队里占有一席之地。

sentences.english: Paula deserves a special mention for all the help she has given us.
sentences.chinese: 应该特别提一下葆拉，她给了我们许多帮助。

sentences.english: I would never hit anyone, even if they deserved it.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会打人，哪怕他欠揍。

sentences.english: What has he done to deserve this punishment ?
sentences.chinese: 他做了什么，竟会受到这样的惩罚？

sentences.english: People who are sent to prison for drunk-driving get what they deserve .
sentences.chinese: 那些醉酒驾车被送进监狱的人是罪有应得的。

detailed_translations.english: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

name: present
trans:
a.出席的；目前的 n. 目前，现在；
礼物 [pri'zent] v. 提出，出示  【派】 presence n. 出席，在场   
【反】 absence n. 缺席【考】 at present 目前，现在

sentences.english: She was presented with an award .
sentences.chinese: 她被授予一个奖项。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone, for example at a formal or official occasion

name: press
trans: v.压，挤，按 n. 报刊，出版界

sentences.english: Oxford University Press
sentences.chinese: 牛津大学出版社

sentences.english: We were able to watch the books rolling off the presses.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以看到书本从印刷机上源源不断地印出。

detailed_translations.english: a business that prints and publishes books

name: pressure
trans: n.压力，紧张

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

name: prevent
trans:
v.阻止，防止
【考】 prevent/stop/keep sb. from doing 阻止某人做某事

sentences.english: The rules are intended to prevent accidents.
sentences.chinese: 这些规定旨在预防事故。

sentences.english: We were prevented from entering the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们被阻止进入现场。

sentences.english: Wrap small ornaments in paper to prevent them being damaged.
sentences.chinese: 把小饰品用纸包上以免损坏。

detailed_translations.english: to stop something from happening, or stop someone from doing something

name: previous
trans: a.先的，前的，以前的 a. （to）在……之前……

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: primary
trans: a.首要的，基本的；最初的

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

name: principle
trans: n.原理，原则；准则【考】 on principle 根据原则

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: prior
trans: a.在前的，优先的     【考】 prior to prep. 在……之前

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: private
trans: a.私人的

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: privilege
trans: n.优惠，特权 v. 给予特权

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

name: prize
trans: n.奖金，奖品

sentences.english: In this month’s competition you could win a prize worth £3,000.
sentences.chinese: 在本月的竞赛中您可以赢得价值3,000英镑的奖品。

sentences.english: The first prize has gone to Dr John Gentle.
sentences.chinese: 获得一等奖的是约翰·金特尔博士。

sentences.english: The prizes are awarded (= given ) every year to students who have shown original thinking in their work.
sentences.chinese: 这些奖项每年颁发给在学习中表现出创造性思维的学生。

sentences.english: The total prize money was £30,000.
sentences.chinese: 奖金总额为3万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: something that is given to someone who is successful in a competition, race, game of chance etc
to think that someone or something is very important or valuable
good enough to win a prize or having won a prize

name: procedure
trans: n.程序，手续

sentences.english: On board, we were given the usual talk on safety procedures (= what to do if an accident happens, or to prevent an accident ) .
sentences.chinese: 在飞机上，我们听了例行的飞行安全讲解。

detailed_translations.english: a way of doing something, especially the correct or usual way

name: proceed
trans: v.继续进行

sentences.english: Before proceeding further, we must define our terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须先定义术语，然后再往下展开。

detailed_translations.english: to continue to do something that has already been planned or started

name: process
trans: n.过程，历程v. 加工，处理

sentences.english: the Israeli-Egyptian peace process
sentences.chinese: 以－埃和平进程

sentences.english: Recycling is an industrial process.
sentences.chinese: 回收利用是一个工业流程。

sentences.english: All university applications are processed through this system.
sentences.chinese: 所有大学入学申请都是由这个系统处理的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过程，进程；；工序；工艺流程
detailed_translations.english: a series of actions that are done in order to achieve a particular result
to deal with an official document, request etc in the usual way

name: profit
trans: n.利润，盈余；利益

sentences.english: The shop’s daily profit is usually around $500.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店每天的利润一般在500美元左右。

sentences.english: She sold the business and bought a farm with the profits.
sentences.chinese: 她卖了公司，用所得利润买下了一座农场。

sentences.english: They sold their house at a healthy profit.
sentences.chinese: 他们卖掉房子，赚了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: There’s no profit in letting meetings drag on.
sentences.chinese: 会议拖拖拉拉没什么好处。

detailed_translations.english: money that you gain by selling things or doing business, after your costs have been paid
to get money from doing something

name: progress
trans:
n.前进，发展；前进 vi. 前进，进行
【考】 in progress 在进行中，在发展中；make progress （in）（在……方面）取得进步

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

name: prohibit
trans: vt.禁止；阻止【考】 prohibit sb. from doing sth. 禁止某人做某事

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

detailed_translations.english: to say that an action is illegal or not allowed

name: promise
trans:
v.承诺，答应 n. 承诺，诺言
【考】 promise to do sth. 承 诺 做 某 事；make a promise 做出承诺；
keep one’s promise 信守（兑现）诺言

sentences.english: If you make a promise, you should keep it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你许下一个诺言，你就应该遵守它。

sentences.english: Last night the headmaster promised a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 校长昨晚允诺进行全面调查。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will definitely happen
to tell someone that you will definitely do or provide something or that something will happen

name: promote
trans: vt.提升，晋升；促进

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: proof
trans: n.证明，证据

sentences.english: Their defences are proof against most weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们的防卫工事可以抵挡大多数武器的攻击。

detailed_translations.english: facts, information, documents etc that prove something is true

name: property
trans: n.财产，资产，所有物

sentences.english: The hotel is not responsible for any loss or damage to guests’ personal property .
sentences.chinese: 宾馆对住客个人财物的丢失和损坏概不负责。

sentences.english: Some of the stolen property was found in Mason’s house.
sentences.chinese: 在梅森家里找到了部分被盗财物。

detailed_translations.english: the thing or things that someone owns

name: proportion
trans: n.部分，比例，比重

sentences.english: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区的很大一部分海豚最终都会死去。

sentences.english: What’s the proportion of boys to girls in your class?
sentences.chinese: 你们班里男女生的比例是多少？

detailed_translations.english: a part of a number or an amount, considered in relation to the whole

name: propose
trans:
v.提议，提名；求婚【派】 proposal n. 提议，建议；求婚
【考】 propose to do sth./doing sth./that ...提议……

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

name: prospect
trans: n.展望，前景

sentences.english: The prospect of marriage terrified Alice.
sentences.chinese: 想到要结婚，艾丽斯害怕极了。

sentences.english: I had no job, no education, and no prospects .
sentences.chinese: 我没有工作，没受过什么教育，前途渺茫。

detailed_translations.english: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

name: protect
trans:
vt.保护【派】 protection n. 保护
【考】 protect ... from/against 保护……不受到损害或侵犯

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: proud
trans: a.自豪的，骄傲的【考】 be proud of 骄傲，自豪

sentences.english: a proud man who would not admit his mistakes
sentences.chinese: 自以为是、不愿认错的男子

sentences.english: Seth was the proud owner of a new sports car.
sentences.chinese: 赛思因为有了新跑车而扬扬得意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 骄傲的；自负的〔含贬义〕；自豪的
detailed_translations.english: thinking that you are more important, skilful etc than you really are – used to show disapproval

name: prove
trans: vt.证明，证实

sentences.english: You’re wrong, and I can prove it.
sentences.chinese: 你错了，我可以证明。

sentences.english: To prove his point (= show that he was right ) , he mentioned several other experiments which had produced similar results.
sentences.chinese: 为了证明自己的观点，他提到了另外几个结果相似的实验。

detailed_translations.english: to show that something is true by providing facts, information etc

name: provide
trans:
v.提供
【考】 provide sb. with sth. 为 某 人 提 供 某 物；provide sth. for sb. 向某人提供某物

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

name: provided
trans: conj.只要，假如

sentences.english: He can come with us, provided he pays for his own meals.
sentences.chinese: 只要他付自己的饭钱，就可以跟我们一起来。

name: public
trans: a.公共的；公开的 n. 公众

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

name: publish
trans: v.出版，公开，发行

sentences.english: The first edition was published in 1765.
sentences.chinese: 第一版于1765年出版。

sentences.english: They are publishing the dictionary on CD-ROM.
sentences.chinese: 那部词典他们将以光盘版的形式推出。

sentences.english: We love reading your letters and we try to publish as many as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢阅读大家的来信，并且会尽量刊登出来。

sentences.english: The latest unemployment figures will be published tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 最新的失业数字将于明天公布。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a book, magazine etc to be written, printed, and sold

name: punish
trans: v.惩罚，处罚

sentences.english: Smacking is not an acceptable way of punishing a child.
sentences.chinese: 要惩罚孩子，不应该用打的方式。

sentences.english: He promised to punish severely any officials found guilty of electoral fraud.
sentences.chinese: 他承诺要严惩任何在选举中有欺诈行为的官员。

sentences.english: They deserve to be punished for putting passengers at risk.
sentences.chinese: 他们置乘客于危险之中，理应受到惩罚。

sentences.english: I felt I was being punished for what my mother had done.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己在为妈妈的所作所为接受惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suffer because they have done something wrong or broken the law

name: purchase
trans: vt.买，购买

sentences.english: She paid for her purchases and left.
sentences.chinese: 她付钱买好东西离开了。

sentences.english: I enclose my receipt as proof of purchase .
sentences.chinese: 我附上小票作为购物凭证。

sentences.english: She made two purchases from my stall.
sentences.chinese: 她从我的货摊上买了两样东西。

sentences.english: You can purchase insurance online.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在网上买保险。

detailed_translations.english: something you buy, or the act of buying it
to buy something

name: pure
trans: a.纯的；完全的，十足的

sentences.english: rings made of pure gold
sentences.chinese: 纯金制成的戒指

sentences.english: Our beef patties are 100% pure.
sentences.chinese: 我们的牛肉饼是100%的纯牛肉。

sentences.english: His motives were pure.
sentences.chinese: 他动机纯正。

detailed_translations.english: not mixed with anything else; with nothing added

name: purpose
trans:
n.目的，意图
【考】 on purpose 故 意 地；for （the） purpose of为……的目的；为的是

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: pursue
trans: vt.追赶；追求；从事

sentences.english: She plans to pursue a career in politics.
sentences.chinese: 她计划从政。

sentences.english: Students should pursue their own interests , as well as do their school work.
sentences.chinese: 除了完成课业之外，学生也应该追求自己的兴趣。

sentences.english: a campaign promise to pursue policies that will help the poor
sentences.chinese: 贯彻扶贫政策的竞选承诺

detailed_translations.english: to continue doing an activity or trying to achieve something over a long period of time

name: qualify
trans: v.取得资格

sentences.english: Free school lunches are given to children who qualify.
sentences.chinese: 符合条件的儿童可获得免费的学生午餐。

detailed_translations.english: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

name: quality
trans: n.质量；性质；品质

sentences.english: Much of the land was of poor quality.
sentences.chinese: 很多地的土质很差。

sentences.english: Use only high quality ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 只使用上等的材料。

sentences.english: the drug’s addictive quality
sentences.chinese: 毒品令人上瘾的特性

detailed_translations.english: how good or bad something is

name: quantity
trans:
n.量，数量
【考】 a large quantity of+ 名词（谓语动词的单复数由名词决定）；
large quantities of+ 名词（谓语动词一律用复数形式）。

sentences.english: Your work has improved in quantity and quality this term.
sentences.chinese: 这学期你的作业在完成数量和质量上都有提高。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that can be counted or measured

name: quarter
trans: n.四分之一；一刻钟

sentences.english: It’s about a page and a quarter.
sentences.chinese: 大概是一又四分之一页。

sentences.english: Cut the cake into quarters.
sentences.chinese: 把蛋糕切成四等份。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you in a quarter of an hour.
sentences.chinese: 我们一刻钟之后见。

detailed_translations.english: one of four equal parts into which something can be divided

name: quit
trans:
v.离开，停止，辞职


【R】

sentences.english: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个同事争吵后就辞职了。

sentences.english: I quit school at 16.
sentences.chinese: 我十六岁辍学。

sentences.english: She has decided to quit show business.
sentences.chinese: 她已决定退出娱乐圈。

sentences.english: People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在正要求主席辞职。

sentences.english: I've quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我戒了烟。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely

name: raise
trans: vt.使升高；抚养，饲养

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

name: range
trans:
vi.（在一定范围内）变化，变动 n.一系列；范围
【考】 range from ... to ... 在……范围内变化；in/within range 在射程内

sentences.english: a temperature range of 72-85˚
sentences.chinese: 72 度到85度之间的温度范围

sentences.english: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (= too expensive for us ) .
sentences.chinese: 即使是最便宜的房子也超出了我们能承受的价格范围。

sentences.english: There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
sentences.chinese: 有120名学生，年龄在10至18岁之间。

detailed_translations.english: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between

name: rank
trans: n.排；等级 v. 评价；把……评级

sentences.english: There were several pairs of riding boots ranked neatly in the hall.
sentences.chinese: 门厅里整齐地摆放着几双马靴。

detailed_translations.english: to arrange objects in a line or row

detailed_translations.chinese: 军衔，职衔；地位，社会阶层；排，行列
detailed_translations.english: the position or level that someone holds in an organization, especially in the police or the army, navy etc
to have a particular position in a list of people or things that have been put in order of quality or importance

name: rapid
trans: a.快的，急速的

sentences.english: The patient made a rapid recovery.
sentences.chinese: 病人迅速康复。

sentences.english: a period of rapid decline
sentences.chinese: 迅速衰退期

sentences.english: He fired three times in rapid succession (= one after another ) .
sentences.chinese: 他接连开了三枪。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done very quickly and in a very short time

name: rare
trans: a.罕见的，稀有的

sentences.english: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物越来越罕见。

sentences.english: I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
sentences.chinese: 我只有偶尔去海伦店里时才会见到她。

sentences.english: It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
sentences.chinese: 她很少有哪一天不上学的。

detailed_translations.english: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often

name: rate
trans: n.速率，比率

sentences.english: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.chinese: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.english: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.chinese: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

detailed_translations.english: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale
to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard

name: rather
trans:
ad.宁可，宁愿；更确切地说
【考】 would rather do ... than do ... 宁愿……也不愿……；rather than 宁愿；不顾

sentences.english: I grew up in rather unusual circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我在相当不寻常的环境中长大。

sentences.english: I'm afraid it's a rather long story.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕这是个相当长的故事。

sentences.english: I’d rather have a quiet night in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿晚上安安静静地看看电视。

detailed_translations.english: fairly or to some degree

name: reach
trans:
vt.伸手（或脚等）够到；到达
【考】 reach for 伸手去拿；摸（某物）；out of reach 够不着

sentences.english: We reached London late at night.
sentences.chinese: 我们深夜到达伦敦。

sentences.english: She reached into her bag and produced a business card.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手从包里取出一张名片。

sentences.english: Chelsea could reach the final of the European Cup.
sentences.chinese: 切尔西队会进入欧洲杯决赛。

detailed_translations.english: to arrive at a place

name: react
trans: v.（作出）反应

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。

sentences.english: You have to react quickly to circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 你必须对形势迅速作出反应。

detailed_translations.english: to behave in a particular way or show a particular emotion because of something that has happened or been said

name: recall
trans: v.回想，想起

sentences.english: You don’t happen to recall his name, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会恰巧还想得起他的名字吧？

sentences.english: As I recall, it was you who suggested this idea in the first place.
sentences.chinese: 我记得，是你首先提出这个想法的。

sentences.english: Cole was recalled to the squad to replace the injured Quinn.
sentences.chinese: 科尔被召回队里代替受伤的奎因。

sentences.english: The cars had to be recalled due to an engine fault.
sentences.chinese: 由于发动机缺陷，那些汽车必须召回。

detailed_translations.english: to remember a particular fact, event, or situation from the past

name: recognize
trans: v.认出，识别；承认

sentences.english: I didn’t recognize you in your uniform.
sentences.chinese: 你穿上制服我认不出你了。

sentences.english: It was malaria, but Dr Lee hadn’t recognized the symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 这是疟疾，但李医生没有认出症状。

sentences.english: One must recognise that homesickness is natural.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须承认思乡是正常的。

detailed_translations.english: to know who someone is or what something is, because you have seen, heard, experienced, or learned about them in the past

name: recommend
trans: v.劝告，建议；介绍，推荐

sentences.english: I recommend the butter chicken - it’s delicious.
sentences.chinese: 我推荐黄油焗鸡，非常好吃。

sentences.english: Can you recommend a good lawyer?
sentences.chinese: 你能介绍一位好律师吗？

detailed_translations.english: to say that something or someone is good, or suggest them for a particular purpose or job

name: recover
trans: v.恢复，痊愈

sentences.english: After a few days of fever, she began to recover.
sentences.chinese: 发烧几天之后，她开始恢复。

sentences.english: Two bodies were recovered from the wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 残骸中找到了两具尸体

detailed_translations.english: to get better after an illness, accident, shock etc

name: refer
trans: v.（to）提到，指；参考，查阅；提交，上呈

sentences.english: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 在他的讲话中，他提到了最近的加拿大之行。

detailed_translations.english: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them

name: refuse
trans: v.拒绝，不接受，不同意

sentences.english: She asked him to leave, but he refused.
sentences.chinese: 她叫他走，但他不肯。

sentences.english: When he offered all that money, I could hardly refuse (= could not refuse ) , could I?
sentences.chinese: 他愿意给那么多钱，我怎么可能拒绝呢？

sentences.english: The town made a weekly collection of refuse.
sentences.chinese: 该镇每周收一次垃圾。

detailed_translations.english: to say firmly that you will not do something that someone has asked you to do
waste material that has been thrown away

name: regard
trans:
vt.看作 n. [ pl.] 问候
【考】 with regard to 关于；regard ... as 把……当作……

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

name: regardless
trans: a.（of）不管/

sentences.english: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她最近动了手术，她却一直在不顾一切地继续工作。

detailed_translations.english: without being affected or influenced by something

name: register
trans: v.登记，注册

sentences.english: Have you signed the hotel register ?
sentences.chinese: 你在酒店登记簿上签名了吗？

sentences.english: Police want a national register of DNA samples.
sentences.chinese: 警方想要一个全国范围的DNA样本登记册。

sentences.english: How many students have registered for English classes?
sentences.chinese: 有多少学生注册选修英语课了？

detailed_translations.english: an official list of names of people, companies etc, or a book that has this list
to put someone’s or something’s name on an official list

name: regular
trans: a.规则的；定期的；经常的

sentences.english: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司定期召集雇员开会。

sentences.english: His breathing was slow and regular.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸缓慢而均匀。

sentences.english: Trains will run at regular intervals from 11 am to 4 pm.
sentences.chinese: 火车从上午11点到下午4点每隔一定时间开行。

sentences.english: We hear from him on a regular basis .
sentences.chinese: 我们定期收到他的来信。

sentences.english: He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (= always at the same time ) .
sentences.chinese: 他每逢星期天6点钟打电话给我们，非常准时。

sentences.english: a regular job
sentences.chinese: 固定的工作

detailed_translations.english: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between

name: reject
trans:
vt.抛弃；拒绝
【近】 refuse

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: relate
trans: v.联系，关联

sentences.english: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

sentences.english: He later related the whole story to me.
sentences.chinese: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

detailed_translations.english: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected

name: relative
trans: n.亲戚 a. 相对的，比较的

sentences.english: The relative merits of both approaches have to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法的相对优点都得考虑在内。

sentences.english: her opponent’s relative lack of experience
sentences.chinese: 她的对手相对来说缺少经验

sentences.english: You may think you’re poor, but it’s all relative (= you are not poor compared to some people ) .
sentences.chinese: 你可能认为自己很穷，但一切都是相对的。

detailed_translations.english: having a particular quality when compared with something else
a member of your family

name: relax
trans: v.放松，松弛

sentences.english: Gentle exercise can relax stiff shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 和缓的运动可以使僵硬的肩部肌肉放松。

detailed_translations.english: if you relax a part of your body or it relaxes, it becomes less stiff or less tight
to rest or do something that is enjoyable, especially after you have been working

name: relieve
trans: v.缓解，消除，减少

sentences.english: Drugs helped to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 药物有助于舒缓疼痛。

sentences.english: A secretary was hired to relieve her of some of the administrative work.
sentences.chinese: 一个秘书被雇来为她减轻一些行政工作的负担。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce someone’s pain or unpleasant feelings

name: religion
trans: n.宗教，信仰

sentences.english: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: a course on philosophy and religion
sentences.chinese: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

sentences.english: the Islamic religion
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教

detailed_translations.english: a belief in one or more gods

name: religious
trans: a.宗教的，信教的，虔诚的

sentences.english: I don’t share her religious beliefs .
sentences.chinese: 她的宗教信仰和我的不同。

sentences.english: a religious school
sentences.chinese: 宗教学校

sentences.english: the dates of major religious observances such as Easter or Christmas
sentences.chinese: 复活节和圣诞节等重要宗教节日的日期

detailed_translations.chinese: 宗教的； 笃信宗教的， 虔诚的
detailed_translations.english: relating to religion in general or to a particular religion

name: reluctant
trans: a.不愿的，勉强的

sentences.english: She gave a reluctant smile.
sentences.chinese: 她勉强笑了笑。

detailed_translations.english: slow and unwilling

name: rely
trans:
vi.依靠，依赖；信赖，信任
【考】 rely on/upon 依赖于【派】 reliable a. 可靠的，可信赖的【近】 depend

sentences.english: I knew I could rely on David.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我可以信赖戴维。

sentences.english: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.
sentences.chinese: 他们非常依赖专业顾问的建议。

detailed_translations.english: to depend on something in order to continue to live or exist

name: remain
trans: v.剩下；保持【考】 remain to do 尚待

sentences.english: The refugees were allowed to remain in the UK.
sentences.chinese: 难民获准留在英国。

sentences.english: They were cleaning up the remains of their picnic.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在打扫野餐的残余物。

detailed_translations.english: to stay in the same place without moving away

detailed_translations.chinese: 残余； 残骸； 遗迹
detailed_translations.english: Theremainsof something are the parts of it that are left after most of it has been taken away or destroyed

name: remarkable
trans: a.显著的，非凡的

sentences.english: She has made remarkable progress.
sentences.chinese: 她取得了显著的进步。

sentences.english: a remarkable coincidence
sentences.chinese: 不寻常的巧合

sentences.english: He’s a remarkable man .
sentences.chinese: 他是个了不起的人。

detailed_translations.english: unusual or surprising and therefore deserving attention or praise

name: remind
trans: v.（of）提醒，使想起

sentences.english: Yes, I’ll be there. Thanks for reminding me.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我会去那里的。 谢谢提醒。

sentences.english: He made a few notes to remind himself of what he wanted to say.
sentences.chinese: 他记了几条，提醒自己要说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone remember something that they must do

name: remove
trans: v.消除；脱掉，搬

sentences.english: a cleaner that will remove wine stains
sentences.chinese: 可去除葡萄酒酒渍的清洁剂

sentences.english: The college removed rules that prevented women from enrolling.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学取消了禁止女性入学的规定。

detailed_translations.english: to get rid of something so that it does not exist any longer

name: replace
trans: v.替换，取代

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

name: represent
trans: vt.代表

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: require
trans:
vt.需求，要求
【考】 require（sth.）of sb.；require doing/to bedone 需要做

sentences.english: Campbell’s broken leg will probably require surgery.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔的一条腿骨折，可能需要手术。

sentences.english: What’s required is a complete reorganization of the system.
sentences.chinese: 需要做的是彻底整顿整个系统。

sentences.english: Most house plants require regular watering.
sentences.chinese: 大多数室内盆栽植物需要定期浇水。

sentences.english: The bill failed to get the required number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 法案没有得到规定的票数。

detailed_translations.english: to need something

name: resemble
trans: vt.（不用于被动语态）像，类似

sentences.english: It’s amazing how closely Brian and Steve resemble each other.
sentences.chinese: 布赖恩和史蒂夫真是惊人地相像。

sentences.english: He grew up to resemble his father.
sentences.chinese: 他长大了，很像他父亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look like or be similar to someone or something

name: resident
trans: n.居民

sentences.english: As one local resident put it in May, "By day there is government.
sentences.chinese: 正如一位当地居民在五月份对它的描述”白天有政府。

sentences.english: A resident said, "I think we should write it down on paper or tell our family members.
sentences.chinese: 一位居民说：“我觉得我们应该把遗嘱写在纸上或者告诉给自己的家人。

sentences.english: Few of her former comrades enjoy this comfort; but, as another resident explained, the authorities like them to live there "to do propaganda and education work".
sentences.chinese: 她以前的同志，很少人能享受能这种舒适生活；不过另一个居民解释说，当局希望他们住在那以“进行宣传教育工作”。

name: resign
trans: v.辞去，辞职【近】 quit

sentences.english: A hospital administrator has resigned over claims he lied to get the job.
sentences.chinese: 一位医院主管因为有人声称他的职位是骗来的而辞职了。

detailed_translations.english: to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization
to officially announce that you have decided to leave your job or an organization

name: resist
trans: v.抵抗，反抗；忍住，抵制【反】 resistant a. 抵抗的；resistance n. 抵抗

sentences.english: to resist change
sentences.chinese: 抵制变革

sentences.english: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.chinese: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept sth and try to stop it from happening

name: resource
trans: n.资源

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: respective
trans: a.各自的，各个的

sentences.english: We all went back to our respective homes to wait for news.
sentences.chinese: 我们都各自回家等待消息。

sentences.english: the respective roles of teachers and students
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生各自不同的角色

detailed_translations.english: used before a plural noun to refer to the different things that belong to each separate person or thing mentioned

name: respond
trans: v.反应；回答【派】 response n. 反应；回答

sentences.english: They are likely to respond positively to the president's request for aid.
sentences.chinese: 他们有可能积极地回应该总统的援助请求。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回答， 答复； 作出反应， 响应
detailed_translations.english: to do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done

name: responsibility
trans:
n.责任，负责；职责，义务
【考】 take（on/over）the responsibility for/ofdoing sth. 负起对（做）某事的责任

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

name: responsible
trans:
a.应负责的，有责任的
【考】 be responsible for sb./sth. 对……负责

sentences.english: We are determined to bring the people responsible to justice.
sentences.chinese: 我们决意要将肇事者绳之以法。

detailed_translations.english: if someone is responsible for an accident, mistake, crime etc, it is their fault or they can be blamed

name: restless
trans: a.不安的，坐立不安的

sentences.english: After a few weeks in Marseille, I grew restless and decided to move on.
sentences.chinese: 在马赛住了几星期后，我开始待不住了，决定换个地方。

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to keep still or stay where you are, especially because you are nervous or bored

name: restrict
trans: v.限制，约束

sentences.english: The new law restricts the sale of hand guns.
sentences.chinese: 新法规限制手枪的销售。

sentences.english: You may need to restrict access to certain files (= limit the number of people who can read them ) .
sentences.chinese: 某些档案可能需要限制查阅。

sentences.english: The agreement will restrict competition.
sentences.chinese: 这个协议将限制竞争。

sentences.english: The cramped living conditions severely restricted the children’s freedom to play.
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的居住条件严重限制了孩子们玩耍的自由。

detailed_translations.english: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

name: result
trans:
n.结果，效果；成绩 vi. 导致
【考】 as a result 由于，因此；result in 结果是；导致；result from 起因于

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

name: retire
trans: v.退休，退出，退役

sentences.english: At the age when most people retire, he is ready to face a new career.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数人退休的年纪，他准备要面对一项新事业。

sentences.english: I retired late that evening.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上我睡得晚。

detailed_translations.english: to stop working, usually because you have reached a certain age

name: return
trans:
vi.返回，回来 n./v. 归还；回报
【考】 in return（for） 作 为 …… 的 交 换；return sth. to sb. 把某物归还给某人

sentences.english: It was forty five minutes before she returned.
sentences.chinese: 过了45分钟她才回来。

sentences.english: Alison decided to return home.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森决定回家。

sentences.english: He left his country, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 他离开了祖国，一去不复返。

detailed_translations.english: to go or come back to a place where you were before
the act of returning from somewhere, or your arrival back in a place
used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again

name: reveal
trans: v.提示，揭露，展现

sentences.english: He may be prosecuted for revealing secrets about the security agency.
sentences.chinese: 他可能因泄露安全部门的机密而被起诉。

sentences.english: a test that can reveal a teacher’s hidden skills
sentences.chinese: 能够展现老师潜在技能的测试

detailed_translations.english: to make known something that was previously secret or unknown

name: revolt
trans: v.反抗，起义

sentences.english: The prime minister is now facing a revolt by members of his own party.
sentences.chinese: 首相现在面临着党内倒戈。

sentences.english: the Polish revolt of 1863
sentences.chinese: 1863年的波兰起义

sentences.english: Some members of the government may revolt against this proposed legislation.3
sentences.chinese: 一些政府成员可能会反对这项拟议中的法规。

sentences.english: The peasants threatened to revolt.
sentences.chinese: 农民威胁说要造反。

detailed_translations.english: a refusal to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws
to refuse to accept someone’s authority or obey rules or laws

name: revolution
trans: n.革命；大改变

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

name: reward
trans: n.酬谢，报酬，奖金 v. 酬谢，报答，奖酬

sentences.english: The school has a system of rewards and punishments to encourage good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 学校有奖惩制度以鼓励良好行为。

sentences.english: The club’s directors rewarded him with a free season ticket.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部的董事们奖给他一张免费季票。

detailed_translations.english: something that you get because you have done something good or helpful or have worked hard
to give something to someone because they have done something good or helpful or have worked fo

name: risk
trans: n.风险 v. 冒风险

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

name: rough
trans: a.粗糙的；粗鲁的，粗暴的

sentences.english: Her hands were rough from hard work.
sentences.chinese: 她的双手因为干重活而变得很粗糙。

sentences.english: the rough terrain at the base of the mountains
sentences.chinese: 山脚下崎岖不平的地形

sentences.english: We were bumping over the rough ground.
sentences.chinese: 我们在崎岖的地面上颠簸而行。

sentences.english: a rough translation
sentences.chinese: 粗略的翻译

detailed_translations.english: having an uneven surface

name: route
trans: n.路线，航线

sentences.english: Trains are taking a lot of freight that used to be routed via trucks.
sentences.chinese: 火车正在运送过去由卡车运送的大批货物。

detailed_translations.english: to send something somewhere using a particular route
a way from one place to another

name: routine
trans: a.例行公事；日常工作

sentences.english: John’s departure had upset their daily routine .
sentences.chinese: 约翰的离去打乱了他们的日常生活。

sentences.english: Try to get into a routine (= develop a fixed order of doing things ) .
sentences.chinese: 尽量养成一套习惯。

sentences.english: my daily exercise routine
sentences.chinese: 我每天的锻炼习惯

sentences.english: Dressing is a task which we do every day as a matter of routine (= done regularly and not unusual ) .
sentences.chinese: 穿衣打扮是我们每天必做的事情。

sentences.english: You mustn’t worry. These are just routine enquiries.
sentences.chinese: 你不必担心，这只是例行的询问。

detailed_translations.english: the usual order in which you do things, or the things you regularly do
happening as a normal part of a job or process

name: royal
trans: a.皇家的

sentences.english: the royal palace
sentences.chinese: 王宫

sentences.english: the royal family
sentences.chinese: 王室

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to a king or queen

name: rude
trans: a.粗鲁的，不礼貌的

sentences.english: a rude remark
sentences.chinese: 粗鲁的话

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to be rude, but I had to leave early.
sentences.chinese: 我并不想显得无礼，但我不得不早走。

detailed_translations.english: speaking or behaving in a way that is not polite and is likely to offend or annoy people

name: ruin
