sentences.english: I tried and tried (= kept making an effort ) and eventually I was offered a job.
sentences.chinese: 我一次次地尝试，终于有人给了我一份工作。

sentences.english: Try as he might (= as hard as he could ) , he could not get the incident out of his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他想尽办法，但脑子里仍摆脱不掉那件事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 试图，努力；试验；审判；考验
detailed_translations.english: to take action in order to do something that you may not be able to do
an attempt to do something

name: trick
trans: n.诡计，花招 v. 哄骗，欺骗【考】 play a trick on sb. 诈骗某人；开某人玩笑

sentences.english: Pretending he doesn’t remember is an old trick of his.
sentences.chinese: 假装不记得是他的老花招了。

sentences.english: He didn’t really lose his wallet - that’s just a trick.
sentences.chinese: 他并没有真的丢了钱包——这只是一个骗局。

sentences.english: The trick is to bend your knees as you catch the ball.
sentences.chinese: 诀窍是接球时要屈膝。

sentences.english: She knew she’d been tricked, but it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 她知道自己被骗了，但为时已晚。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to deceive someone
to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something

name: trip
trans: n.旅行，远足

sentences.english: Two lucky employees won a round-the-world trip.
sentences.chinese: 两名幸运的雇员赢得一次环游世界的机会。

sentences.english: It’s an 80-mile round trip (= a journey to a place and back again ) to Exeter.
sentences.chinese: 到埃克塞特往返有80英里。

sentences.english: I’m afraid you’ve had a wasted trip (= a trip in which you do not achieve your purpose ) . Mr Burgess has already left.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕你是白来一趟了，伯吉斯先生已经走了。

sentences.english: He was unable to make the trip to accept the award.
sentences.chinese: 他无法前去领奖。

detailed_translations.english: a visit to a place that involves a journey, for pleasure or a particular purpose
to hit something with your foot by accident so that you fall or almost fall

name: trouble
trans:
v.困扰，使烦恼，麻烦 n. 烦恼，困难【派】 troublesome a. 令人烦恼的
【考】 in trouble 处 于 困 境， 在 困 难 中；have trouble（in）doing sth. 做某事有困难

sentences.english: Recent stock market losses point to trouble ahead.
sentences.chinese: 最近股市的下跌预示着未来将有麻烦。

detailed_translations.english: problems or difficulties
to say something or ask someone to do something which may use or waste their time or upset them

name: trust
trans: n.信任，信托 vt. 相信，信任，信赖【考】 trust in 相信

sentences.english: At first there was a lack of trust between them.
sentences.chinese: 起初，他们之间缺乏信任。

sentences.english: an agreement made on the basis of mutual trust
sentences.chinese: 在相互信任的基础上达成的一项协议

sentences.english: You betrayed your father’s trust (= did something bad even though he trusted you ).
sentences.chinese: 你辜负了你父亲对你的信任。

sentences.english: I just don’t trust him.
sentences.chinese: 我就是不信任他。

sentences.english: The money your father left you will be held in trust until you are 21.
sentences.chinese: 你父亲留给你的钱将被托管到你满21岁。

detailed_translations.english: a strong belief in the honesty, goodness etc of someone or something
to believe that someone is honest or will not do anything bad or wrong

name: truth
trans: n.真实，真相；真理

sentences.english: How do we know you’re telling us the truth?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎么知道你告诉我们的是真话？

sentences.english: The experience has taught us some basic truths.
sentences.chinese: 这次经历教会我们一些基本的道理。

sentences.english: How do we know you’re telling us the truth?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎么知道你告诉我们的是真话？

detailed_translations.english: the true facts about something, rather than what is untrue, imagined, or guessed

name: turn
trans:
vt.旋转 vi. 绕；翻动，变化 n. 次序，旋转
【考】 turn away 将拒之门外          turn on 打开                     turn off 关上
turn up（音量）调大            turn down（音量）调小         turn ... into 把……变成
turn out 结果是，最终成为      turn over 翻转；移交            in turn 依次，轮流

sentences.english: Ricky turned and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 里基转身走了。

sentences.english: She turned her head in surprise.
sentences.chinese: 她惊讶地转过头来。

sentences.english: Brigitte glared at him, turned on her heel (= turned away suddenly because of anger ) , and stomped out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 布丽吉特瞪了他一眼，猛地一转身，噔噔噔地走出了房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 转动，使旋转；转弯；翻过来；兑换
detailed_translations.english: to move your body so that you are looking in a different direction

detailed_translations.chinese: 转弯；变化；(损害或有益于别人的)行为，举动，举止
detailed_translations.english: a sudden or unexpected change that makes a situation develop in a different way

name: type
trans: n.类型，品种，样式 v. 打字

sentences.english: I’ve already seen a few movies of this type.
sentences.chinese: 我已经看过几部这种类型的影片了。

sentences.english: He types with two fingers.
sentences.chinese: 他用两个手指打字。

detailed_translations.english: one member of a group of people or things that have similar features or qualities
to write something using a computer or a typewriter

name: typical
trans:
a.有代表性的，典型的


【U】

sentences.english: typical British weather
sentences.chinese: 典型的英国天气

sentences.english: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

detailed_translations.english: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

name: uncertain
trans: a.不确定的

sentences.english: My whole future now seemed uncertain.
sentences.chinese: 现在我的前途似乎是个未知数。

detailed_translations.english: feeling doubt about something

name: undergo
trans: v.遭受，经历

sentences.english: The country has undergone massive changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家最近经历了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: He has been released from prison to undergo medical treatment in the United States.
sentences.chinese: 他获释出狱去美国接受治疗。

sentences.english: She has been undergoing tests since Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她从星期一开始一直在接受各种检查。

sentences.english: Teachers should be expected to undergo mid-career training and development.
sentences.chinese: 教师应该参加中期职业培训和发展活动。

detailed_translations.english: if you undergo a change, an unpleasant experience etc, it happens to you or is done to you

name: underline
trans: vt.在……下面画线；强调，加强

sentences.english: This tragic incident underlines the need for immediate action.
sentences.chinese: 这一悲剧事件突显了立即采取行动的必要性。

detailed_translations.english: to draw a line under a word to show that it is important

name: undertake
trans: v.接受，承担

sentences.english: University professors both teach and undertake research.
sentences.chinese: 大学教授既要教学又要从事研究工作。

sentences.english: He undertook to pay the money back in six months.
sentences.chinese: 他保证在六个月之内还钱。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself responsible for sth and start doing it

name: uneasy
trans: a.局促的；不安的

sentences.english: She eventually fell into an uneasy sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她终于睡着了，但睡得并不踏实。

sentences.english: Ninety percent of those questioned felt uneasy about nuclear power.
sentences.chinese: 受访者中有90%的人对核能感到忧虑。

detailed_translations.english: worried or slightly afraid because you think that something bad might happen

name: unexpected
trans: a.想不到的，意外的

sentences.english: The experiment produced some unexpected results.
sentences.chinese: 这次试验产生了一些意想不到的结果。

sentences.english: Her death was totally unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 她的死完全出人意料。

sentences.english: Hague’s announcement was not entirely unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 黑格的声明并非完全出乎意料。

detailed_translations.english: used to describe something that is surprising because you were not expecting it

name: union
trans: n.结合；统一；工会，联盟

sentences.english: Are you planning to join the union?
sentences.chinese: 你打算加入工会吗？

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["union members"]}
sentences.chinese: 工会会员

detailed_translations.english: an organization formed by workers to protect their rights

name: universe
trans: n.宇宙，万物

sentences.english: Einstein's equations showed the universe to be expanding.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在扩大。

detailed_translations.english: all space, including all the stars and planets

name: unless
trans: conj.如果不，除非

sentences.english: Unless some extra money is found, the theatre will close.
sentences.chinese: 要是不能找到更多资金，剧院将要关闭。

sentences.english: I think you should complain – unless, of course, you are happy with the way things are.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得你应该发发牢骚——当然，除非你对现状很满意。

sentences.english: He won’t go to sleep unless you tell him a story.
sentences.chinese: 要是你不给他讲故事他就不睡觉。

sentences.english: I can’t leave her unless I know she’s all right.
sentences.chinese: 除非我知道她没事，否则我不能离开她。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something will happen or be true if something else does not happen or is not true

name: unload
trans: vt.卸；卸货

sentences.english: Unload everything from the boat and clean it thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 从小船上卸下所有的货物并彻底地清洗。

detailed_translations.english: to remove a load from a vehicle, ship etc
to remove a load from a vehicle, ship etc

name: upset
trans: n.混乱 v. 扰乱 a. 烦乱的，不高兴的

sentences.english: You’re not still upset with me, are you?
sentences.chinese: 你不是还在生我的气吧？

detailed_translations.chinese: 心烦的， 苦恼的； 不适的
detailed_translations.english: unhappy and worried because something unpleasant or disappointing has happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 使心烦意乱，使苦恼，使不适；搅乱；弄翻，倾覆
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel unhappy or worried
an illness that affects the stomach and makes you feel sick

name: use
trans:
vt.使用，用 [juːs] n. 用法，用途
【派】 useful a. 有用的；useless a. 无用的
【考】 use up 用尽，耗光； make use of 使用，利用；be used to do sth. 被用来做某事

sentences.english: Can I use your phone?
sentences.chinese: 我可以用一下你的电话吗？

sentences.english: I’ll show you which room you can use.
sentences.chinese: 我来跟你说一下你可以用哪个房间。

sentences.english: I always use the same shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 我一直用同一种洗发水。

sentences.english: Use your imagination when planning meals.
sentences.chinese: 安排三餐时要动点脑筋。

sentences.english: She booked the flight using a false name.
sentences.chinese: 她用化名预订了航班。

detailed_translations.english: if you use a particular tool, method, service, ability etc, you do something with that tool, by means of that method etc, for a particular purpose

detailed_translations.chinese: 使用， 应用； 用途， 效用
detailed_translations.english: the action or fact of using something

name: used
trans:
vi.（to）惯常 a. 习惯于……的；用过的，旧的
【考】 used to do sth. 过 去 经 常 做 某 事；get/be used to doing sth. 习惯于做某事


【V】

sentences.english: I do the dishes every day, so I’m used to it.
sentences.chinese: 我每天洗盘子，所以习惯了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 习惯的；二手的，使用过的
用（use的过去式）；（used to）过去常做

name: vacant
trans: a.空着的；空缺的；【反】 occupied a. 已占用的；无空闲的；在使用

sentences.english: Only a few apartments were still vacant.
sentences.chinese: 只有几套公寓仍然空着。

sentences.english: There was only a vacant lot (= empty unused area of land in a city ) where her house used to be.
sentences.chinese: 她以前房子所在的地方只剩下一块空地了。

detailed_translations.english: a vacant seat, building, room or piece of land is empty and available for someone to use

name: vacation
trans: n.休假，假期【近】 holiday

sentences.english: What will you do this vacation?
sentences.chinese: 你这个假期将干什么？

sentences.english: Do you have any vacation plans?
sentences.chinese: 您假期有什么安排吗？

sentences.english: Do you have any idea for this vacation?
sentences.chinese: 这个假期你有什么想法吗？

detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere for a holiday
a holiday, or time spent not working

name: vain
trans: a.自负的，徒劳的，无效的【考】 in vain 徒劳，无效

sentences.english: Police searched in vain for the missing gunman.
sentences.chinese: 警方搜寻失踪的持枪歹徒，但毫无结果。

sentences.english: Men can be just as vain as women.
sentences.chinese: 男人有时会和女人一样虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: without success in spite of your efforts

name: value
trans:
n.价值，益处 v. 评价；重视
【考】 be of value 有价值；of no value 没价值的

sentences.english: The alterations doubled the value of the house.
sentences.chinese: 经改建后这所房子增值了一倍。

sentences.english: We decided to get the house valued.
sentences.chinese: 我们决定给房子估一估价。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that something is worth
to decide how much money something is worth, by comparing it with similar things

name: vanish
trans: v.消失，消散【近】 disappear vi. 消失，不见

sentences.english: My keys were here a minute ago but now they’ve vanished.
sentences.chinese: 我的钥匙刚刚还在这里，现在却不翼而飞了。

sentences.english: The bird vanished from sight.
sentences.chinese: 那只鸟从视线中消失了。

sentences.english: She seemed to have just vanished into thin air (= suddenly disappeared in a very mysterious way ).
sentences.chinese: 她好像就蒸发了似的。

detailed_translations.english: to disappear suddenly, especially in a way that cannot be easily explained

name: vanity
trans: n.虚荣心，浮华

sentences.english: Sabrina had none of the vanity so often associated with beautiful women.
sentences.chinese: 萨布里娜没有一点漂亮女人经常会有的那种虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: too much pride in yourself, so that you are always thinking about yourself and your appearance

name: various
trans: a.各种各样的，不同的【近】 different

sentences.english: The jacket is available in various colours.
sentences.chinese: 这种夹克有好多种颜色可选。

sentences.english: There are various ways to answer your question.
sentences.chinese: 有多种方法可以回答你的问题。

sentences.english: He decided to leave school for various reasons.
sentences.chinese: 出于种种原因，他决定辍学。

detailed_translations.chinese: 各种各样的， 不同的
detailed_translations.english: if there are various things, there are several different types of that thing

name: vary
trans: v.改变，变化；有差异

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

name: vast
trans: a.巨大的，广阔的；大量的

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: vehicle
trans: n.车辆，交通工具

sentences.english: a description of the stolen vehicle
sentences.chinese: 对被盗车辆的描述

sentences.english: Have you locked your vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你锁车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck

name: victim
trans: n.牺牲品，受害者

sentences.english: The victim received head injuries from which she died a week later.
sentences.chinese: 受害人头部受伤，一周后死亡。

sentences.english: a credit card fraud ring that stole millions of dollars from unsuspecting victims
sentences.chinese: 从毫无戒心的受害者手中盗取数百万美元的信用卡诈骗团伙

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been attacked, robbed, or murdered

name: victory
trans: n.胜利

sentences.english: Union leaders are heading for victory in their battle over workplace rights.
sentences.chinese: 工会领袖们在争取工作场所权利的斗争中正迈向胜利。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which you win a battle, game, election, or dispute

name: view
trans: v.看，考虑 n. 风景；观点，见解【考】 in view of 鉴于，考虑到

sentences.english: an opportunity to view the film before it goes on general release
sentences.chinese: 在影片公映之前观影的机会

detailed_translations.english: to think about something or someone in a particular way

name: violent
trans: a.暴力的，猛烈的

sentences.english: the increase in violent crime
sentences.chinese: 暴力犯罪的增多

sentences.english: violent clashes between the police and demonstrators
sentences.chinese: 警方与示威者之间发生的暴力冲突

sentences.english: 31 people have been injured in violent incidents throughout the day.
sentences.chinese: 今天一天有31人在暴力事件中受伤。

sentences.english: The riots ended in the violent deaths of three teenagers.
sentences.chinese: 动乱以三名少年的惨死而告终。

detailed_translations.english: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc

name: vision
trans: n.视觉，视力

sentences.english: She suffered temporary loss of vision after being struck on the head.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受撞击以后出现暂时性失明。

sentences.english: Tears blurred her vision (= made it difficult for her to see ).
sentences.chinese: 泪水模糊了她的视线。

sentences.english: The idea came to her in a vision.
sentences.chinese: 她在神示中想到了这个主意。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to see

name: vital
trans: a.至关重要的

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: vivid
trans: a.生动的，鲜艳的，鲜明的

sentences.english: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

name: vocation
trans: n.行业，职业    【派】 vocational a. 行业的，职业的

sentences.english: At 17 she found her true vocation as a writer.
sentences.chinese: 17岁时她找到了自己真正的使命——当一名作家。

detailed_translations.english: a particular type of work that you feel is right for you

name: volume
trans: n.（一）卷，（一）册；体积，容积；音量

sentences.english: Can you turn the volume up?
sentences.chinese: 请你把音量调大好吗？

sentences.english: The volume of the container measures 10,000 cubic metres.
sentences.chinese: 这个容器的容量是1万立方米。

sentences.english: The period from 1940 – 1945 is in volume 9.
sentences.chinese: 1940年至1945年这段时间在第9卷。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of sound produced by a television, radio etc

name: volunteer
trans: v.自愿效劳 n. 志愿者【派】 voluntary a. 自愿的

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: vote
trans: v.选举，投票

sentences.english: A vote for us is not a wasted vote.
sentences.chinese: 投我们的票是不会白投的。

sentences.english: The proposal was rejected by 19 votes to 7.
sentences.chinese: 那项提议以19票对7票被否决。

sentences.english: policies designed to win votes in the South
sentences.chinese: 旨在赢取南方选票的各项政策

sentences.english: It’s the club secretary that counts the votes.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部干事负责清点选票。

detailed_translations.english: an act of voting in an elec­tion or meeting, or the choice that you make when you vote

detailed_translations.chinese: 提议，使投票；投票决定；公认
detailed_translations.english: to show which person or party you want, or whether you support a plan, by marking a piece of paper, raising your hand etc

name: voyage
trans:
n.航海，航程


【W】

sentences.english: The voyage from England to India used to take six months.
sentences.chinese: 过去从英格兰到印度要航行六个月。

sentences.english: the Titanic’s maiden voyage
sentences.chinese: “泰坦尼克”号的首航

sentences.english: I don’t want to make the voyage single-handed.
sentences.chinese: 我不想独自航行。

sentences.english: These are the voyages of the starship Enterprise.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是“企业”号星舰几次航行的经历。

detailed_translations.english: a long journey in a ship or spacecraft
to travel to a place, especially by ship

name: wake
trans: vi.醒来 vt. 唤醒【考】 wake up 醒过来；叫醒

sentences.english: When she woke, the sun was streaming through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 她醒来时，阳光泻入窗内。

sentences.english: Try not to wake the baby.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要吵醒宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: to stop sleeping, or to make someone stop sleeping
the time before or after a funeral when friends and relatives meet to remember the dead person

name: wander
trans: vi.漫游，游荡，漫步，流浪

sentences.english: She wandered aimlessly around the streets.
sentences.chinese: 她在大街上漫无目的地到处游荡。

sentences.english: Pauline started to wander from the point.
sentences.chinese: 保利娜开始偏题了。

sentences.english: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose

name: warn
trans:
v.警告，注意，通知
【考】 warn sb. of sth. 警告某人某事；warn sb.against doing sth. 警告某人不要做某事

sentences.english: ‘Be careful, the rocks are slippery,’ Alex warned.
sentences.chinese: “小心，岩石很滑。”亚历克斯提醒说。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it

name: waste
trans: n.废物；浪费 v. 浪费【考】 waste sth. on sth.

sentences.english: excessive waste in state spending
sentences.chinese: 政府支出方面的过度浪费

detailed_translations.chinese: 浪费；废物；荒地；损耗；地面风化物
detailed_translations.english: when something such as money or skills are not used in a way that is effective, useful, or sensible
to use more money, time, energy etc than is useful or sensible
waste materials, substances etc are unwanted because the good part of them has been removed

name: wave
trans: v.挥手，挥动；波动 n. （热，光，声等的）波，波浪

sentences.english: Dee watched the waves breaking on the shore.
sentences.chinese: 迪伊凝视着拍岸的波涛。

sentences.english: The ship tipped over, and finally vanished beneath the waves.
sentences.chinese: 船倾覆了，最终沉没在海浪之下。

detailed_translations.english: a line of raised water that moves across the surface of the sea
if you wave something, or if it waves, it moves from side to side

name: way
trans:
n.路，路线；方式，手段
【考】 on one’s way to 在去……的途中；in a way在某种程度上；
by the way 顺便说； lose one’s way 迷路

sentences.english: My family was in a bad way financially.
sentences.chinese: 我家当时经济窘迫。

sentences.english: The chicken’s nice and crispy – just the way I like it.
sentences.chinese: 这鸡肉很脆，正是我喜欢的口味。

sentences.english: It’s worth thinking how you can improve the way things are.
sentences.chinese: 你应该想想如何让现状变得更好。

detailed_translations.english: a particular state or condition

name: wealth
trans: n.财富，财产

sentences.english: The country’s wealth comes from its oil.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的财富来自石油。

sentences.english: the distribution of wealth
sentences.chinese: 财富的分配

sentences.english: The purpose of industry is to create wealth.
sentences.chinese: 工业的目的就是创造财富。

detailed_translations.chinese: 财富； 财产； 丰富
detailed_translations.english: a large amount of money, property etc that a person or country owns

name: weapon
trans: n.武器，兵器

sentences.english: They all had sticks which they planned to use as weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们都持有棍棒，打算当武器用。

detailed_translations.english: something that you use to fight with or attack someone with, such as a knife, bomb, or gun

name: weep
trans: v.哭泣，流泪

sentences.english: James broke down and wept.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯控制不住感情，哭了起来。

sentences.english: He wept bitterly (= cried a lot ) when it was time for us to leave.
sentences.chinese: 我们要分别的时候他痛哭了一场。

detailed_translations.english: to cry, especially because you feel very sad

name: weigh
trans: vt.称……重量；掂量【派】 weight n. 重量，体重

sentences.english: The young birds weigh only a few grams.
sentences.chinese: 雏鸟重量只有几克。

sentences.english: Do you know how much it weighs?
sentences.chinese: 你知道它的重量吗？

sentences.english: (= how much ) do you weigh?
sentences.chinese: 你的体重是多少？

sentences.english: The box was full of books and weighed a ton (= was very heavy ).
sentences.chinese: 这箱子里放满了书，重得很。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular weight

name: welfare
trans: n.福利（事业）

sentences.english: Our only concern is the children’s welfare.
sentences.chinese: 我们唯一关心的是孩子们的幸福。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

name: wide
trans: a.宽阔的 ad. 完全地，充分地【反】 narrow

sentences.english: a man with a wide experience of foreign affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交事务经验丰富的人

sentences.english: Our aim is to bring classical music to a wider audience.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目的是把古典音乐带给更多的听众。

detailed_translations.chinese: 广泛的；宽的，广阔的；张大的；远离目标的
detailed_translations.english: including or involving a large variety of different people, things, or situations
opening or spreading as much as possible

name: widespread
trans: a.分布广的，普遍的

sentences.english: the widespread use of chemicals in agriculture
sentences.chinese: 化学品在农业中的广泛使用

detailed_translations.english: existing or happening in many places or situations, or among many people

name: wild
trans: a.野生的；荒芜的；野蛮的

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["wild animals"]}
sentences.chinese: 野生动物

sentences.english: a field full of wild flowers
sentences.chinese: 遍地野花的田野

sentences.english: animals both wild and domesticated
sentences.chinese: 野生动物和家养动物

detailed_translations.chinese: 野生的；野蛮的；狂热的；荒凉的
detailed_translations.english: living in a natural state, not changed or controlled by people
in natural and free conditions, not kept or controlled by people
if plants run wild, they grow a lot in an uncontrolled way

name: wise
trans: a.有智慧的，聪明的

sentences.english: a wise precaution
sentences.chinese: 明智的预防措施

sentences.english: I don’t think that would be a very wise move (= not be a sensible thing to do ).
sentences.chinese: 我认为那样做不是很明智。

detailed_translations.english: wise decisions and actions are sensible and based on good judgment

name: wish
trans:
v.希望；但愿；祝福 n. 希望；心愿
【考】 当 wish 后的宾语从句中表示与现在事实相反的愿望时，从句常用虚拟语气。

sentences.english: Close your eyes and make a wish.
sentences.chinese: 闭上眼睛许个愿。

detailed_translations.english: a desire to do something, to have something, or to have something happen
to want something to be true although you know it is either impossible or unlikely

name: witness
trans: n.目击者，见证人v. 目击，目睹

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

name: wonder
trans:
v.对……疑惑；想要知道n. 惊讶；奇迹
【考】 It’s no wonder （that 从 句 ）=No wonder ...难怪……

sentences.english: What are they going to do now, I wonder ?
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，他们现在打算怎么办呢？

sentences.english: He’s been leaving work early a lot – it makes you wonder , doesn’t it?
sentences.chinese: 他最近经常提早下班——让人觉得奇怪，是不是？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something that you are not sure about and try to guess what is true, what will happen etc

name: word
trans:
n.单词；言语；诺言
【考】 in a word 总而言之；in other words 也就是说；keep one’s word 守信

sentences.english: Write an essay of about five hundred words.
sentences.chinese: 写一篇约500字的文章。

sentences.english: What does that word mean?
sentences.chinese: 那个单词是什么意思？

sentences.english: ‘Vater’ is the German word for (= that means ) ‘father’.
sentences.chinese: vater在德语中是“父亲”的意思。

sentences.english: Perhaps ‘lucky’ is not exactly the right word .
sentences.chinese: 也许“幸运”一词还不够贴切。

detailed_translations.chinese: [语] 单词；话语；消息；诺言；命令
detailed_translations.english: a single group of letters that are used together with a particular meaning
to use words that are carefully chosen in order to express something

name: worship
trans: v.崇拜 n. 崇拜，礼拜（仪式）

sentences.english: The ceremony must take place in a recognized place of worship.
sentences.chinese: 该仪式必须在获得认可的敬拜场所举行。

sentences.english: He absolutely worships her.
sentences.chinese: 他太崇拜她了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 礼拜；崇拜；崇拜: 爱慕：崇敬
detailed_translations.english: the activity of praying or singing in a religious building in order to show respect and love for a god
to admire and love someone very much

name: worth
trans:
a.值……钱，值得的 n. 价值
【考】 worth 只能做表语，后接名词或动名词的主动形式。

sentences.english: One of the pictures is worth £50,000.
sentences.chinese: 其中一幅画值5万英镑。

sentences.english: You should not deprecate your own worth.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该贬低你自己的价值。

detailed_translations.english: having a value in money, etc.
how good or useful something is or how important it is to people

name: worthwhile
trans: a.值得（做）的

sentences.english: He wanted to do a worthwhile job.
sentences.chinese: 他想做有意义的工作。

sentences.english: We decided to give the money to a worthwhile cause (= one that helps people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把这笔钱投入到慈善事业中。

detailed_translations.english: if something is worthwhile, it is important or useful, or you gain something from it

name: wound
trans: n.创伤，伤口 v. 受伤，伤害

sentences.english: A nurse cleaned and bandaged the wound.
sentences.chinese: 护士把伤口清洗包扎好。

sentences.english: It took several months for his wounds to heal .
sentences.chinese: 他的伤口几个月后才愈合。

sentences.english: The doctor said it was only a flesh wound (= one that does not cut the skin very deeply ) .
sentences.chinese: 医生说那只是皮肉伤。

sentences.english: a gaping wound (= one that is wide and open ) on his thigh
sentences.chinese: 他大腿上裂开的伤口

sentences.english: Gunmen killed two people and wounded six others in an attack today.
sentences.chinese: 在今天的一起袭击事件中，持枪歹徒打死两人，打伤六人。

detailed_translations.english: an injury to your body that is made by a weapon such as a knife or a bullet
to injure someone with a knife, gun etc

name: wrap
trans: v.卷，包，缠绕

sentences.english: I’ve still got a few Christmas presents to wrap up.
sentences.chinese: 我还有一些圣诞礼物要包起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put paper or cloth over something to cover it
a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders

name: wreck
trans: n.失事，海难；沉船，残骸v.（船等）失事，遇难

sentences.english: Divers discovered the wreck of an old German warship.
sentences.chinese: 潜水员发现了一艘沉没的德国旧军舰。

sentences.english: Injury threatened to wreck his sporting career.
sentences.chinese: 伤病可能会毁了他的运动生涯。

detailed_translations.english: a ship that has sunk
to completely spoil something so that it cannot continue in a successful way

name: yield
trans: v.生产，出产；让步，屈服   n. 产量，收获量

sentences.english: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information
